Title: Scientist/Engineer, Process & Formulations
Text: Scientist/Engineer, Process & Formulations  About:  X-Therma develops novel, convergent chemical technologies in biopreservation to advance the field of regenerative medicine by making available safe and on-demand organs for transplant, engineered tissues, and cell therapies for the patients in need. The Company is devoted to lead innovation that enables global Regenerative Medicines on-demand to improve modern medicine and save, repair & rejuvenate billions of lives from today to eternity. We are a team who is here to improve each other every day. We appreciate talent, and it is X-Therma's mission to satisfy your personal development goal to become better everyday, however you define it. We are located in the beautiful and busy SF East Bay area. Description:  We are seeking an enthusiastic and motivated individual who can excel within the small team dynamic of a startup company, enjoys working on game-changing projects, and thrives under emerging challenges to drive projects to completion. The scientist/engineer serves as a critical component in the product development work at the interface between biology, chemistry, and engineering, and is capable to blend the key attributes of technology development and CMC production. She/he will lead development of products from bench work to actively participating in strategic business planning as it relates to product development technical challenges. The scientist/engineer will lead a small group of junior level scientists and manage internal R&D and CMC as well as external collaborations with customers and strategics. The position is responsible for optimizing formulation development while building robust and scalable manufacturing processes. She/he will also develop product and raw material specifications, design and execute laboratory and pilot scale experimental plans, analyze, and report data, and manage project timelines. She/he is responsible to transfer project goals from senior management and develop a thorough plan with punctual execution for the technical team culminating in clearly and wel organized key reports. The ideal end-results can be achieved by pristine planning, proactive trouble shooting, improving efficiency, minimizing variation and reduction of the COGs. This position is an exceptional opportunity to gain a complete picture of the product life-cycle with hands-on experience, cross-division interaction, and leadership development. Made for you who is eager to grow! This workflow is expected to split approximately 65% of time in lab and 25% of time in communications and operations. Responsibilities:  -Self-starter with proven ability to effectively drive projects from concept to launch, execute tasks within defined programs timelines and work independently with limited oversight -Anticipate potential technical issues before they occur and establish action plan with supervisor and technical team -Drive programs to completion to meet timelines -Take responsibility as a team lead, and also serve as excellent team mate with others both internally and externally Development component: (20%) -Design and perform multivariate studies of different formulations of a particular product, minimizing the number of replicates while maximizing the amount of information obtained -Develop and implement of high-throughput and automation approach that enhance formation development operations -Leverage a deep knowledge of cryobiology and regenerative medicine field in modify excipients (inactive ingredients) to improve the formulation stability, biocompatibility and drive to successful final products -Perform labor platform engineering design for existing projects, including troubleshooting, upgrades and capacity expansions, equipment management and upgrading. -Responsible for data interpretation, analysis and generating concise technical reports, peer review publications and white papers CMC component: (65%) -Hands-on preparation of formulations for the projects targeting variety of biosystems -Develop robust processes and well documented SOPs for scale-up production and formulation QC process -Design and adhere to quality control processes??? -Develop detailed COGs analysis of raw material sourcing and process compliance with the regulatory need -Facility setup, maintenance, and calibration of laboratory equipment that meeting the compliance requirement -Prepare and characterize molecules using appropriate analytical tools including IR, NMR, MS, GC, and HPLC Outreach component: (15%) -Serve as internal technical lead in participating pilot and other business meetings, industrial/academic conferences -Maintain current awareness of scientific literature and field trends -Prepare technical reports, and peer review publications (e.g. papers and presentations) and other white papers -Proactively review and assess the impact of regulatory guidance on current and future operations Required experience and skills: -M.S. or Ph.D. in chemistry, chemical engineering, biochemistry, or related discipline -5+ years of related industry experience -Proven development of processes within a CMC / cGMP environment -Exhibit excellent organization, planning and multi-tasking skills -Takes pride in completing tasks with diligence and detail -A proactive attitude for all tasks (process development, innovation, approach, communication) is required in a dynamic team environment -No task is too big or too small for you …. “can do” personality-Must have strong interpersonal skills to establish efficient work-flow and communications with internal departments as well as external customers -Proven excellent written/verbal and presentation skills, excellent publication records -Assess activities using a risk management approach -Ideal candidate must be self-driven, highly efficient, and output focused, put in occasional overtime and weekend hours as required -Able to physically lift 25-50lbs -Must be able to perform chemistry bench research without prohibitive limitations Exceptional candidates: -Persistent individual who is eager to grow with the team to achieve the ultimate goal: Organs on Demand -Exceptional team lead as well as a supportive team player -Strong processing skills in organic synthesis, solid-phase synthesis, purification, and characterization -Experienced in automation and high-throughput synthesis or screening -Engineering skills are plus, such as programming, instrumentation, fluid dynamics, CAD, etc. -Experience in the Regenerative Medicine industry such as cell banking, cell & gene therapy, engineered tissue constructs, and organ transplantation -Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in cryopreservation X-Therma is an Equal Opportunity Employer. X-Therma does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $80,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off COVID-19 considerations:We wear KN-95 masks and practice social distancing as much as we can. Experience: Formulation: 5 years (Preferred) Location: Richmond, CA 94806 (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Title: Quality Engineer - Job # 777 - Contract (12 months) - Sunnyvale, CA
Text: Quality Engineer - Job # 777 - Contract (12 months) – Sunnyvale, CA Medical Engineering Consultants (MEC) support medical device and pharmaceutical companies to be more efficient and productive by providing resources, knowledge and expertise to augment and supplement their work. Our vision is to closely align our clients’ needs with the best resources available in the marketplace. We take proactive, preventative and corrective action and create a roadmap for ongoing future improvement by identifying, integrating and executing sustainable solutions that validate processes, ensure fully compliant quality systems, and close gaps between current and FDA expected stages. MEC offers companies short or long-term support — from high-end leaders, managers and consultants to skill-set Engineering staff and SME’s (Subject Matter Experts). MEC's mission is to inspire positive cultural change from within, and always exceed our clients’ expectations.  Responsibilities: Develops, modifies, applies and maintains quality standards and protocol for processing materials into partially finished or finished materials product Collaborates with engineering and manufacturing functions to ensure quality standards are in place Devises and implements methods and procedures for inspecting, testing and evaluating the precision and accuracy of products and production equipment Designs or specifies inspection and testing mechanisms and equipment; conducts quality assurance tests; and performs statistical analysis to assess the cost of and determine the responsibility for products or materials that do not meet required standards and specifications Ensures that corrective measures meet acceptable reliability standards and that documentation is compliant with requirements Requirements: B.S. Degree in Engineering discipline with 2+ years’ experience or advanced degree with 0 years of experience  Sponsorship/ Corp to Corp is not available for this position Equal Employment Opportunity Medical Engineering Consultants (MEC) is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or Veteran status.  MEC does not accept unsolicited resumes through or from search firms or staffing agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered the property of Medical Engineering Consultants (MEC) and will not be obligated to pay a placement fee.  Check us out at www.medicalengineeringconsultants.com AAP/EEO DFWP Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Title: Junior Process Engineer
Text: What You'll Do The Junior Process Engineer will be working full time in the cleanroom to conduct micro and nano-fabrication on novel projects and ideas related to Leia's core backlight displays. As a JR Process Engineer your responsibilities include but are not limited to: Build and calibrate various custom and off the shelf optical tools and equipment Perform R&D tests and experiments Collect and analyze experimental data Address technical challenges experienced by our R&D facility and production facility Support facilities operations, tool building and fixit Participate and support senior engineers on relevant research and development projects in nano-fabrication and process engineering. The engineer is expected to understand, use and run advance nanofabrication tools for R&D purposes: Run Track, Run Stepper, Run Etcher for process engineer developments Engineer needs to be able to support all process engineering requirements to Leia's mass production Imprints This is a position based at Leia Inc's Nanofabrication Lab in Palo Alto, CA. What You'll Have Experience working in a cleanroom environment Hands-on experience with micro-optical assembly, soldering, and wiring Proven record of being consistent, meticulous and detailed in completing assigned tasks Self-motivation and commitment to fulfilling projects and deliverables in a timely fashion Comfortable in supporting a fast-pace R&D environment Strong team player with excellent interpersonal communication skills Ability to follow lab instructions safely and precisely Nice to Haves Experience with electronics lab equipment, including multimeters, oscilloscopes, and soldering equipment Experience with optical, optomechanical, and fiber optic components Experience with optical measurements, SEM, AFM At Leia we are working at the forefront of display technology — making screens come to life in richer, deeper, and more beautiful ways. We apply our proprietary nanotechnology to give any display the ability to produce Lightfield, immersive "holographic" content — no glasses, no tracking, no fuss. Come join a team that's ready to redefine the digital experiences of tomorrow! In order to assemble top talent to help realize this mission Leia offers our employees: Competitive Compensation Package Medical, Dental, and Vision Plan Retirement Savings Plan 401(k) Catered lunch and dinner daily (Dependent on Location) Stocked kitchen with healthy (and unhealthy) snacks and beverages Onsite workout facility (Dependent on Location) Leia Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Candidates are evaluated without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal or state law.  #LI-EL1

Title: Process Improvement Engineer
Text: Job Description Summary: Process Improvement Engineer (PIE)The Process Improvement Engineer (PIE) role is responsible for maintaining & improving true efficiency (TE), running efficiency (RE), production system capabilities, and operational stability. Responsibilities include cost efficiency, continuous improvement on processes, service, and safety. The PIE develops mastery of the processes they are assigned to and uses that mastery to deliver improved TE, quality, and yield.Major Tasks, Accountabilities and Key Responsibilities: Oversee the Centerline System management, including its development, maintenance & change management Responsible for loss analysis & TE improvement plan development, plan execution leadership, and results tracking Facilitate Lean Six Sigma (LSS) project management throughout the plant Responsible for rapid changeover activities including principles, target setting, and leading successful efforts reducing changeover time to achieve challenging objectives Oversee analytical troubleshooting & problem solving Develop an annual operating plan, yield, cullage, and fixed budgets. Coach and train others on these as well Develop team to solve day-to-day operational issues and reach short- and long-term performance goals Deliver effective change leadership - driving business changes while minimizing people impact Communicate and collaborate cross-functionally to assist the team to solve operational issues Motivate team members to achieve plan goals Understand the fundamental tools & methodologies of the following TPM pillars – FI, AM, PM, EM Understand the CQV process – Commissioning, Qualification, Verification process Provide weekly, period, and ‘Year to Date’ reliability and variability downtime analysis support to the operation Apply reliability expertise to stabilize and improve the operation, driving variation down and seeking improved TE through the capital, procedural, and operational improvements in both planned and unplanned downtime areas Demonstrate good oral and written communication skills through leading meetings, facilitating meetings and preparing written plant communications Assist in plant initiatives and direct line supervision as needed Administer policies and procedures Regular and predictable attendance at the worksite This role requires regular presence on the plant floor This role requires lifting up to 40 lbs. occasionally This role requires occasional work in poor weather conditions, including heat, cold, rain, or snow This role may operate forklift and manufacturing equipment occasionally This role may require off-shift and weekend work This role may require some travel (less than 5%)  Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required. Preferably in engineering, business, operations management, or similar field Lean Six Sigma Experience preferred, demonstrated by successful completion of a major improvement project 2 + years of manufacturing experience in a consumer products manufacturing operation preferred Must be self-motivated, results and action oriented Ability to make independent and sound decisions Ability to conduct assessments and audits and evaluate to measure progress Effective oral and written communication skills Solid understanding of Business Finance principles Proficient in Microsoft Suite applications Ability to give and receive constructive feedback Ability to lead a team-based approach to decision making Demonstrated ability to work in a results-oriented, challenging environment Strong leadership with the ability to get results through mentoring others Effective coaching, facilitation, presentation, and team building skills Must be authorized to work in the United States

Title: Senior Engineer I (Mechanical) – Chassis & Body Structure
Text: GILLIG LLC is the largest and most dependable manufacturer of Heavy Duty Transit Buses in North America. Our customers are in all 50 states, and include cities, counties, transit districts, universities and major private fleet operators. We are headquartered in Livermore, CA. About the Role: The Senior Engineer - Mechanical for Chassis, Body and Interior is responsible for engineering design, problem resolution and other engineering duties in support of New Product Engineering. In this role, you will be a key contributor in the future product development of all GILLIG's new models including conventional and zero-emission products. This person will have direct influence at sub system level to optimize the piece parts and sub-systems. You will undertake multiple, independent and complex tasks simultaneously and manage competing priorities, often in a fast paced and dynamic setting. This position reports to the Engineering Manager, but may also get direction/guidance from senior engineers. You will collaborate with internal and external partners to interpret customer requirements, supply chain capabilities, manufacturing capabilities and business needs. You will contribute to complex designs at the subsystem and vehicle level, devising optimal product solutions in concert with electrical and product validation peers. You will work within a team setting to create manufacturing and procurement ready drawings, bills of material and installation guidelines. You will also collaborate with supply chain, manufacturing and quality functions to ensure designs are aligned with all stakeholders. This position reports to the Mechanical Engineering Manager of New Product Engineering, located at our manufacturing plant in Livermore, CA. This is a direct, full-time position with GILLIG. Technical Focus: Sheet metal design for vehicle chassis Aluminum extrusion design for body structure Structural validation through advanced finite element analysis techniques Design of complex systems routing and sub assembly packaging The Day to Day: Can communicate subsystem level design/idea to internal/external customers Evaluates customer product requirements and develops product designs to meet customer needs Interpret customer requirements, and map requirements onto existing designs when possible, and/or develop new designs when needed Optimize designs via analytical, numerical and/or empirical assessments. Make mechanical and thermal models/analysis to insure product requirements are met Produce and/or evaluate possible design solutions to improve cost, quality, delivery and performance on specialized knowledge of engineering applications together with possible involvement of other functional engineers and/or customer/supplier personnel Direct CAD designer to complete 3D models and drawings as necessary Release drawings accordingly to support production cost estimation and prototype quotes Review CAD models and drawings at the component and sub system level to ensure their integrity Use CAD modeling software to create components, assemblies, and engineering drawings for manufacturing Mechanical design including design for manufacture and assembly Documentation of final design upon the successful development of component and simple subsystem, which includes releasing the final technical specification, related design calculation, and the design manual or guideline Create and maintain Bill of Materials (BOM) along with all project documentation Design and document solutions, within the scope of concepts, for components and modules, taking project guidelines (e.g. safety, quality, costs, weights and dates) into consideration Advise stakeholders on the technical issues that affect the product design, production cycle-time & cost Analyze assignments and determine engineering specifications which must be fulfilled for problems or projects Support production ramp & ongoing/continuous product/process improvement Perform and coordinate laboratory testing of prototypes for sub system characterization Work with the test engineer(s) to create DVP&R, execute the defined test plan and review the test results/reports Conduct field testing and provide preliminary evaluations Develop and maintain the technical specification for desired performance at the sub system level Ability to prioritize assigned tasks to maintain schedule Works independently on assigned subsystem tasks with some guidance required from senior engineers on sub system level tasks Works productively with other engineers, designers, technicians, sales representatives, installers, and project managers so the project is delivered on schedule and on budget Provide technical design support to sales, product engineering, manufacturing, and quality organizations Provide technical guidance to junior engineers at component and subsystem level Organize design review with the manufacturing engineer team as well as project review with the management team to make sure product development completion on time Support purchasing, field service and other internal customers as required Lead or support prototype order and procurement Operate in a team environment and provide input to design solution during the design development phase Apply knowledge of company products, policies and practices to provide economies through standardization of parts and products. Apply lean principles in designs and processes Area of expertise at the subsystem level Continually develops individual analytical skills and is also knowledgeable about the best tools and methods to analyze a given design problem and develop a good understanding of design risk factors. (Pre req for DFMEA line above) Model and drawing documentation is accurate and complete Exhibits insight and mechanical design sense to develop and meet design requirements with product designs that are manufacturable, cost-efficient, reliable, and better than the competition. Hands on troubleshooting of vehicle systems Lead Root Cause Analysis Makes sound decisions after careful deliberation of the alternatives and will revisit prior decisions as justified by new information Released designs are cost effective, manufacturable, serviceable, meet all performance objectives, and meet customer requirements Supports design decisions with detailed analyses Validate designs virtually with FEA and CFD along with real world validation using test rigs, dynamometer, etc. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor work visa's now or in the future About You: Understanding of Heavy-Duty Transit Bus Duty Cycle Understanding of and ability to read and produce mechanical drawings Understanding and application of structural Finite Element Analysis (FEA) for components and weldments Understanding and application of Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing (GD&T) Understanding of automotive mechanical systems and functions and ability to read and product mechanical drawings Understanding of typical manufacturing tolerances associated with sheet metal and machined parts Familiarity with automotive industry standards such as SAE, NFPA, FMVSS, etc. Familiarity with manufacturing processes and environment BS in Mechanical Engineering Minimum 5 years of engineering experience About the environment: Ability to lift up to 25 lbs. Working environment is primarily indoors (office and production environment), however, at times may require time spent outdoors. Regularly required to sit, stand, and walk; occasionally kneel or squat. May be required to work overtime based on business needs Limited domestic travel Start time 6am  After 130 years, GILLIG holds strong to its family values and focus on its employees and customers. Our motivated and dedicated employees have a passion for quality and customer satisfaction. We are committed to building buses that connect communities, eliminate congestion, and contribute to a greener environment. Our Company pride is exemplified by the thoughtful design and quality craftsmanship present in every GILLIG bus. GILLIG's steadfast focus on quality and unwavering commitment to exceptional customer service sets us apart from our competition.  In compliance with the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988, GILLIG has a longstanding commitment to provide a safe, quality-oriented and productive work environment consistent with the standards in which the company operates. Drug abuse poses a threat to the health and safety of GILLIG employees and to the security of the company's equipment and facilities. For these reasons, GILLIG is committed to the elimination of drug and alcohol use and abuse in the workplace. All applicants must pass a drug test before beginning work. GILLIG offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including 100% company-paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employees and their families. Other benefits include a unique 401k profit-sharing plan. GILLIG is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor work visa's now or in the future.

Title: Associate Engineer Systems Test
Text: EngineeringQualifications:Your opportunities for achievement are limitless with Northrop Grumman Space Systems.At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on projects and programs that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to improve the present, invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an endless drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.Northrop Grumman is seeking an Associate Systems Test Engineer This position will be located at our Space Sector in Roy, UT.The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman'sGround Based Strategic Deterrent.The selected candidate will work in a dynamic people-focused environment where he/she will interact with users, customers and other developers. Where they could synthesize customer contractual needs and requirements into system test solutions that acknowledges technical, schedule and cost constraints. Develop and directs preparation and execution of comprehensive test plans, procedures and schedules for completing systems. Coordinate integrated testing activities. Review and evaluate test requirements to insure completeness of test program. Perform technical analysis of complete systems and prepares comprehensive system level evaluations.

Title: Validation Engineer
Text: Talentry is looking for a remote Validation Engineer who can provide process validation support for new and legacy product manufacturing. This includes investigating deviations, nonconformance reports, and validation compliance reviews. The best person for this role will use his or her experience in an ISO/FDA cGMP environment to validate diagnostic medical device manufacture. Qualifications: BS, or equivalent, and 1-3 years of experience. Experience with validation in an FDA regulated cGMP environment. Proven experience with diagnostic or medical devices. Proven experience with validation processes and documentation. Job Type: Contract Pay: From $35.00 per hour Schedule: Monday to Friday Contract Length: 1 year Full Time Opportunity: Yes This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Work Remotely: Yes

Title: Part time- Assistant office engineer
Text: We are looking for an assistant office engineer/document controls to support Project Manager in daily office and engineering in the San Francisco office for construction management services contracts for roads, bridges, highways, rail transit, water infrastructure, and aviation projects. The candidate will require to work at construction project sites as-needed basis. This is a part-time position with the experience in the following is required: Must have excellent communication and technical writing skills Minimum 1-2 years of experience in the engineering, construction or construction management field; Must be detail-oriented with effective organization and coordination skills, Degree in engineering, architecture, construction management or engineering/architecture student Experience or willing to learn in project accounting and billings; Experienced in candidates/resumes shorting, telephonic candidate screening/interview, resume correction, and submitting to the client. Must be high spirited and a team player. Scope of Work:  Assist project managers in the preparation of the response to qualification or proposal, and other general correspondence; Assist project manager in posting jobs, screening candidate, communication and hiring; Assist project manager in the project management, construction administration, processing of payment requests, change orders, submitting Requests for Information (RFIs); Assist project manager with meeting minutes, project status update entries, accounting, change orders, RFI, and submittal logs; Attend construction meeting and prepare meeting minutes; Document Controller maintains all logs; Establish and maintain hard file system common to all projects We will provide the opportunity to learn Construction Scheduling, Quantity Take-off, Cost Estimating, and Project Management to qualified candidates. Qualified female and minority applicants are encouraged to apply. Please submit resumes and expected Salary by email. Candidate must have either a green card or permit to work (US Citizen). No H1 visa sponsorship is available. Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Internship Pay: $17.00 - $19.00 per hour Benefits: Dental Insurance Health Insurance Vision Insurance Schedule: Day shift Experience: Office Engineer/ Office Management: 1 year (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: San Francisco, CA 94110 (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Application Question: how many years of creative writing experience? Hours per week: 10-19 Work Remotely: No

Title: Mechanical Engineer A
Text: Do you want to make a significant difference in how the world is looking tomorrow and contribute to the innovation of state-of-the-art, cutting-edge technology products? Then look no further and join our team in San Jose, CA What you will do Responsible for independent research and development tasks of considerable importance and complexity relating to the more complicated phases of an over-all engineering project.  Uses best practices and procedures to solve problems in the analysis, design, development, implementation, modification, and testing of mechanical, and electro-mechanical components, sub-assemblies and systems used in instrumentation for the life sciences. Defines mechanical and robotics design and testing specifications. Analyzes, develops and recommends design approaches required to meet proposed product requirements. Reviews and approves related inputs such as drawings and specifications prepared by technical support personnel. Selects components and equipment based on analysis of specifications and reliability. Reviews vendor capability to support product development.  Responsibilities will include Conducts engineering tests and/or scientific experiments, and evaluates results, exercising independent judgment within the limits of delegation utilizing established engineering and research techniques. Researches new mechanical engineering practices, procedures and tools to maintain proficiency and experience with emerging technologies. Interacts with customers and/or suppliers in resolution of specific problems unique to their respective applications. Works closely with all departments of the organization, such as Marketing and Production, to plan and coordinate project activities and communicate status. Normally receives assignments from engineering management or project leaders. Exercises considerable discretion as to work detail, tools, etc. Communicates status to senior management as needed. May assign work to and direct draftsmen and engineering technicians as required. Ensures that product test, design and development work is documented in conformance with the Tecan Quality Management System. Supports the Quality System and Quality Policy by following procedures / work instructions and creating records to meet the requirements of the Tecan Quality Management System.  What you bring along Requires BS degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent plus 3-5 years of applicable mechanical engineering experience. Experience in design of sheet metal and precision machined components essential. Proficiency in 3D solid modeling design software required (Pro/E strongly preferred). Good hands-on mechanical aptitude. Biotechnology Instrumentation or Medical Device design and/or motion control experience a plus.  What you will get Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits package Progressive employment conditions Exciting career opportunities Wide range of training courses International environment Strong company culture with rich history  Look no further and apply now! We are looking forward to receiving your application online. Please submit your resume.  Tecan is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Title: Mechanical Engineer
Text: The responsibilities for the position will include designing the translating and rotating structure for a human CT scanner. The design will entail brainstorming solutions, risk mitigation, documenting requirements, designing the drive systems, designing the structural supports, performing structural analysis, writing test protocols, and supporting 510(k) submission. The ideal candidate will be proficient in SolidWorks, have experience designing positioning systems, have expertise in structural analysis, have knowledge of vendors for linear and rotating drive systems, and knowledge of quality systems for medical devices. The candidate should have a minimum of a bachelor's degree from an accredited university and at least two years of relevant experience. This position will be based in the United States.

Title: Quality Engineer
Text: JOB DESCRIPTION  - Complies with all BOS, ISO/TS-16949 and Customer Specific requirements. - Understands Plant/Customer KPI’s and works with team to meet and exceed. - Participates as Layered Process Auditor if instructed by Manager. - Responsible to ensure that continuous improvement is made in all Production Quality Deliverables (e.g.: RTY, Craftsmanship, RPPM, CPPM, SPPM and Warranty / JD Power). - Provide support on PPAP package preparation for product submissions and approval by appropriate Customer personnel. Obtain approval of submission packages from the Product Service Manager or Quality Manager prior to submission to the Customer. - Develop and update Control Plan as required. - Support the Manufacturing Engineer in updating the PFMEA as required. - Develop appropriate inspection plans and containment plans. - Utilize all Customer-specific systems (e.g.: Daimler-Chrysler PRISM, GM PRR, Ford WERS). - Responsible to conduct capability studies, and ensure that they are properly performed and documented for special characteristics, and that Customer and internal requirements are met (or a written Customer deviation is obtained). - Support the continuous improvement of the Operation Description Sheets (ODS). - Identify and utilize the appropriate statistical tools. Mentor team members on proper statistical application and techniques. - Interface with assigned external customers as the single point contact for issue resolution. - Responsible for completion of any customer specific advanced quality planning requirements. - Responsible for writing and submitting 8-Ds to the customer in a timely manner. - Visit the customer on an as needed basis. - Communicate between the customer and the plant. - Initiates the Quality Alert when concerns arise and follow the alert until it is closed. - Confirm all customer return material analysis root causes and corrective actions.  PRIMARY LOCATION

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Text: Marketing Data Analyst - SQL  *Warrior Made is a mission-driven body transformation company that strives to empower everyone to feel great in their bodies. The thread of wellness runs deep in our company, and we believe that our people cannot care for customers unless they care for themselves, which is why we offer generous benefits and time off policies. We’re a startup, so no two days are the same! We’re looking for people who thrive in that ever-changing environment, and who love to grow, communicate and be part of an amazing team.**As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will drive insights to make key business decisions. You will build SQL queries and use your excellent problem solving skills to produce accurate data sets for reporting. You might also spend some time maintaining our data warehouse, building reports, evaluating how best to report on marketing- or product-related issues, or liaising with other departments to increase data awareness and adoption. Ultimately, your position allows us to understand the customer journey and make data-driven business decisions.**Day-to-day, you will: Support all reporting efforts by building simple and complex SQL queries Fix gaps in the data warehouse with data manipulation Maintain data ingest into the warehouse with Stitch Refine, analyze and create reports Work as a data ambassador between different departments, providing reports and sometimes guidance on how to use and adjust them **Requirements: Team-oriented, we-before-me attitude Great communication skills Experience creating SQL queries Experience validating and maintaining data integrity Experience working with Google’s suite of marketing tools (Data Studio, Google Analytics, Tag Manager OR Google Optimize) Experience with Google Sheets or Microsoft Excel Some experience maintaining data ingest Some experience working with a marketing team Familiarity with GCP/Big Query/PubSub a plus Familiarity with Stitch a plus * Job Type: Full-time Pay: $28.00 - $42.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee discount Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations:Warrior Made's physical office is closed until the end of 2020, at which point we will evaluate whether to continue working from home due to COVID-19. Title: Quality Assurance Analyst (QA)/Supervisor
Company: Energy Choice California - an Answernet Company
Text: Energy Choice California: Quality Assurance Analyst (QA)/Supervisor Company Information: Energy Choice California is a contact center that partners with external clients, and with CCAs in California to provide communities with a choice to purchase cleaner energy at competitive rates. CCAs procure renewable sources of electricity for their customers and utilize the power lines, owned by the local utility, to distribute this renewable energy. Responsible For: Quality Assurance Analyst (QA) is responsible for assessing the quality of the performance of our call center associates who deal with our existing customer. The QA will monitor inbound and outbound calls to assess associate’s demeanor, technical accuracy, data accuracy, customer service performance, and conformity to company/client policies and procedures. This individual will assist in developing, creating and implementing call center quality processes and procedures; as well as making recommendation for enhancements to training materials as needed to enhance the overall Answernet customer’s experience As a Supervisor you will be responsible for coaching, mentoring and assigning tasks to your team. This position will be based out of the Pittsburg office at 329 E. Leland Rd. Pittsburg CA 94565. Job Duties / Responsibilities / Essential Functions: Participates in design of call monitoring formats and quality standards. Performs call monitoring and provides trend data to site management team. Participates in customer and client listening programs to identify customer needs and expectations. Coordinates and facilitates call calibration sessions for call center staff. Provides feedback to call center team leaders and managers. Prepares and analyzes internal and external quality reports for management staff review. Perform other duties as assigned. Assist in meeting call center goals for individuals and teams Hire and onboard new employees As a subject matter expert, answer questions and provide guidance Monitor call queues Required Knowledge / Skills / Abilities /Qualifications Organized and detailed oriented Analytical with information files Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Strong customer service skills, diplomacy, and tact Demonstrates ability to lead Management skills Must be team oriented Must be self-motivator and self-starter. Focus on quality and customer service. Exceptional listening and analytical skills. Solid time management skills. Must be able to effectively deal with people at all levels inside and outside of the Company. Ability to multitask and successfully operate in a fast paced, team environment. Must adapt well to change and successfully set and adjust priorities as needed. Work Experience – 2 years, customer service experience Must be proficient with Microsoft Office (intermediate Word, basic Excel). Job Type: Full-time Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour Experience: Quality Assurance: 2 years (Preferred) Work Location: One location This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment This Job Is: A job for which military experienced candidates are encouraged to apply A “Fair Chance” job (you or the employer follow Fair Chance hiring practices when performing background checks) A job for which all ages, including older job seekers, are encouraged to apply A job for which people with disabilities are encouraged to apply Company's website: https://answernet.com/ Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Business Analyst, Vertical Strategy
Text: Who We Are: Persado is a pure-play AI company that's changing the way Fortune 500 companies communicate with their customers by unlocking the power of words and transforming the way ideas are born. Among others, we work with GAP, Dell, Verizon, Humana and 8 of the top 10 U.S. credit card companies, including JP Morgan Chase and American Express. In an ecosystem that's obsessed with personalization –the right offer, the right product, the right segment– we believe that the right message is the one core functional need for every company in the world, making the Choice of Words a multi-billion dollar blind spot for Silicon Valley. We are the only company with the technology to claim that blind spot in the Enterprise Personalization stack.  What We Are Looking For: Persado is looking for a Business Analyst in our Strategic Consulting team based in San Francisco or New York. This is a key role that works closely with our customer success teams to help understand, build, and articulating business cases that describe the value delivered by Persado on our clients' businesses. These business cases incorporate key client initiatives and imperatives, and forecasts the financial impact across various strategies, tactics, and channels. The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious, quantitatively oriented, comfortable working with ambiguity, confident in presenting their work, bright, ambitious, self-driven, hard-working and flexible. He or she will also have the following qualifications: Who You Are: Have experience in developing business cases in MS Excel or equivalent software A total of at least 5 years of successful experience developing models for financial, operational, planning, or GTM functions Be comfortable presenting and reviewing your work in front of internal and external senior executives Have the ability to develop defensible and contextually appropriate assumptions in the absence of complete data sets Ability to create executive summaries that briefly describe the key takeaways from a business case, key assumptions and weaknesses, and ways to improve the predictive power of the business case Comfortable doing industry research and describing industry trends in easily digestible narrative form Ability to develop strategic briefs based on client specific research to describe a client's specific issues, likely industry challenges, and guidance for internal teams on likely client pain points Capacity to work independently with limited supervision Nice to Haves: Experience in presenting to senior executives Experience in the financial budgeting and planning processes Industry career experience in relevant verticals of retail, financial services, insurance, healthcare, telecommunications, and technology Math, statistics, or science degree or background What We Want You To Do: Develop arms-length business cases for target clients Research industry and clients in order to develop assumptions where hard data may not be available Create executives summaries of business cases for internal and external senior executive consumption Develop strategic briefs for target clients based on primary research, prior discussions with clients in similar industries, and aggregation of institutional knowledge Present business cases to both internal and external senior executives Present strategic briefs to both internal and external senior executives Cultivate relationships to help validate business with clients Assist account teams in understanding their client's vertical and articulate how to align the account team's activities to the client's imperatives and industry-specific needs Limited travel, <20% depending on vertical, client portfolio, and role Who You Are: Intellectual curiosity is critical Must be enthusiastic, professional and highly proactive Thrives on finding intriguing solutions to ambiguous problems Collaborative team player with the ability to shift gears quickly and efficiently Dependable and reliable with clear thinking and attention to detail Truly loves working in a fast-paced, creative environment, whose passion is evident in their work Great sense of humor and outlook on life What We Offer: Achieve your life goals and work goals at Persado. Competitive salary and equitable compensation - We're committed to equal pay with regular market rate salary adjustments Generous Benefits Package globally Company Equity 401k to prepare for your future Paid holidays and flexible paid-time-off Annual company off-sites to keep our global offices feeling local Persado Cares! 2 paid Volunteer days per year and charitable giving matching Weekly meals and a fully-stocked kitchen with snacks and drinks Structured onboarding Continuous Learning & Development tied to a personalized career path Diversity and inclusion initiatives All the gear you need to work smart Classification: Public

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Text: Sitting within the Analyst team here at V12, you will be in a hands-on role as the primary source for the initial process design and implementation of V12 core data management applications. You will be responsible for providing a range of services throughout the full customer lifecycle, from technical pre-sales support through implementation and post deployment production support, at all times ensuring that clients’ requirements are understood, and technical solutions are mapped against these requirements with a clearly stated ROI for the customer; you will be required to be innovative in showing the client how our suite of applications can be configured to meet their business objectives. Responsibilities · Work with MS SQL Server for SQL report, query, and stored procedure development, as well as for SQL data analysis, manipulation, and optimization · Automate, optimize, and maintain ETL processes in scalable fashion · Assist with architecture and design of data warehouse and data integration platforms · Work with analytics, engineering, and business teams to define and build marts and tables to optimize reporting performance · Assist with database health monitoring and performance optimization and quickly respond to reported data issues · Import, evaluate and document client data to be utilized to attain stated objectives. · Using V12 Data product offerings, develop/implement processes to transform source data into value-added solutions that meet our client’s Solution objectives · Includes data transformation, development of identity based business rules (i.e. matching, householding, etc), exception processing, designated output parameters, derived calculations, and custom reports. · Develop a workflow using a combination of proprietary & non-proprietary tools. Produce the desired process output, unit test output through the production of sample extracts, processing counts, summary totals and other QC techniques in accordance with established standards. · Support clients using V12 Data product suite through software support, process consulting and evaluation. · Identify, develop, and recognize new opportunities for expanding each Customer’s V12 adoption and ensure ongoing adoption of the V12 platform by each customer · Collaborate effectively with the Sales organization to close incremental revenue and secure long-term renewals Requirements · Experience with MS SQL Server (minimum 5 years) · Experience with T-SQL (minimum 2 years) · Experience using SQL database tools and resources across multiple environments · Experience in the development and management of ETL processes and data integration pipelines using tools such as SSIS, etc. a plus · Experience in scripting languages such as Python, Unix/Windows Shell, etc. a plus · Data modeling for data intensive application from star schema, dimensional modelling, and data lake architectures a plus · Ability to work independently and to collaborate effectively across functions as part of a team in a matrixed environment · Highly analytical with excellent critical thinking ability learning in a fast-paced environment. · Brings professionalism, positive energy and enthusiasm to the team. Genuinely enjoys working with clients on complex business problems and creatively solving for those using a varied technology stack. Has a heart of service to their team and their assigned client portfolio. · Strong work ethic and high personal standard of quality. Can self-govern. · Goal oriented, flexible thinker. Embraces change as an opportunity for improvement. Not satisfied with status quo. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) Matching Dental Insurance Disability Insurance Employee Assistance Program Flexible Spending Account Health Insurance Life Insurance Paid Time Off Referral Program Vision Insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work authorization: United States (Preferred) Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: Temporarily due to COVID-19

Title: Program Analyst
Text: SOUTH CENTRAL WORKFORCE COUNCIL Program Analyst Salary: $4,082 - $5,994/Month ($23.55 – $34.58/hr.) Location: Administrative Office – Yakima County Reports to: Program Manager Position Info: Regular Full time FLSA Status: Non-Exempt - Full time SUMMARY:  Promotes, develops, coordinates and evaluates Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA) Title 1, Discretionary as well as other federal, state and local workforce related programs across Workforce Development Area IX (Kittitas, Klickitat, Skamania and Yakima Counties). Evaluates effectiveness of programs through the collection and analysis of program data. Provides oversight to contractors of the Council in the delivery of program services. Duties are performed under the direct supervision of the Program Manager. Essential Job Functions:  Assist Program Manager with oversight of Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (WIOA) Title 1 Programs, state and federal Discretionary Programs and other Council projects. Oversees the delivery of workforce services for contracted program or projects as assigned. Promotes community awareness of programs and WorkSource system through contacts with service agencies, media or other formats. Develops and maintains cooperative working relationships with service providers and contractors, community groups, educators, advisory boards, and special interest groups involved with workforce and education services. Serves on state and local work groups and implements policy and program direction with providers. Participates in community and state-wide initiatives that promote workforce programs. Regularly and routinely monitors services and performance with subrecipients and contractors gaining feedback regarding program goals, service and priorities; developing new services or program modifications as needed. Routinely reviews contracted work or grant responsibilities to ensure compliance with federal, state and local laws, rules and regulations. Uses existing database systems or develops other data collection methods as needed to evaluate and analyze quantitative and qualitative data for program effectiveness and progress toward meeting outcomes. Assist Program Manager in developing and negotiating contract standards with subrecipients such as expenditures, service levels and performance targets. Assist Program Manager in negotiating performance and payments with funding source; and monitors program budgets and expenditures to ensure the Council is meeting funding source spending schedules. Conduct on-site monitoring to evaluate and document program performance; compliance and progress toward attainment of the established goals and quality of service. Assist Program Manager in reviewing billing/invoices to validate expenditures for consistency, accuracy and compliance with contractual plan and requirements. Recommend technical assistance where needed; determine training needs; coordinate training, and provide individualized or group technical assistance to service providers as needed. Recommend corrective action to Program Manager as needed. Assist Program Manager in procurement of local service providers and develop related subcontracts and agreements. Analyze the effects of policies, rules and regulations upon the program, prepare related reports, and monitor program activities to ensure compliance. Develop and work with State, MIS staff, financial staff, and contractors in implementing program tracking and reporting procedures. Other Job Functions Provide other duties necessary for the effective implementation of project grants and programs. Provide and brief Workforce Council administrative staff and Board as necessary for policy development on program activities, services and outcomes. May assist in the writing and tracking of grant proposals and applications as targeted by the Workforce Development Council and local leadership. May assist in writing narrative for the South Central Strategic, Operations, and Regional (if required) Plans. KNOWLEDGE OF: (Upon Entry) Effective written and oral communication methods; Formal and informational research methods; and Customer service techniques. SKILLS & ABILITIES: (Upon Entry) Functional understanding of federal, state and local grant and sub-agreement principles and techniques; Customer service techniques and team building concepts; Operational methods, principles, issue and service standards as related to the initiative; Understanding of budget management principles and contracting requirements; Reading, interpreting and applying federal and state legislation and complex regulations; * Providing advanced technical assistance individually and in a group setting; Tabulating and summarizing numerical and written data; Coordinating work activities and handling multiple tasks; Developing and implementing long and short range plans and programs; Interviewing, monitoring, contractual compliance and working with service providers; Giving presentations, public speaking, and facilitating meetings; Researching, gathering and analyzing statistics and other information and writing reports; Establishing and maintaining effective interpersonal relations with State, County and other agency officials, at all organizational levels and with the public; and Communications, oral and written, sufficient to exchange or convey information and to give and receive work direction. Advanced computer skills and experience in Windows operating system, MS Outlook, MS Excel, database applications, and MS Word. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:  A Bachelor's degree in public administration, education, social services or related field; and three years of job experience (contract/program administration or workforce initiatives) in workforce development or in a related community service area OR possess a combination of education and direct job experience that clearly demonstrates the knowledge, skills and abilities to perform the essential duties of the position. WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and taste or smell. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus. The employee is required to be present on a regular, reliable, and routine basis. The work environment characteristics described are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of the Job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually low. Work is performed mostly indoors in an office setting with some travel locally and minimal travel within Washington State. EQUIPMENT OPERATED:  A personal computer and related software applications (ETO, eJAS, Word, Excel), basic office equipment (telephone, copy and fax machines, adding machine, calculator), and personal automobile. OTHER REQUIREMENTS:  Personal transportation, valid Washington State Driver’s License and current automobile insurance. AT THE INTERVIEW: An Excel and Word knowledge test. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $4,082.00 - $5,994.00 per month Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Disability insurance Flexible spending account Health insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Experience: Workforce Development: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) License: Driver's License (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative Company's website: http://www.southcentralwdc.com/ Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Work Remotely: No

Title: Research Assistant
Text: Position: Research Assistant Intern Industry: Healthcare & Wellness Commitment: 40 hours per week Start Date: August 2020 Location: Remote Experience: Junior-level (6+ months relevant experience) Compensation: Competitive hourly rate, plus additional benefits listed below Aware Healthcare Inc. is looking for someone proactive and detail-oriented with excellent written and verbal communication skills to join our Summer 2020 Internship Program as a Research Assistant (RA). As we build our “thermometer of the mind,” we are looking for a Research Assistant who is confident in their verbal communication skills. We are looking for someone who is empathetic, non-judgemental, clear, and concise in their communication. They must feel comfortable video chatting with patients who have a substance-use disorder and guide them through the software installation process. In 15 minutes, they must be able to create a safe environment that reflects Aware Healthcare's sense of empathy and care. They must demonstrate that Aware Healthcare is committed to providing quality service. They also appreciate the sensitivity and confidentiality of users' data and, therefore, recognize how critical it is to handle this information in a secure fashion. The Research Assistant should be detail-oriented and able to take ownership over administrative tasks, like maintaining logs of electronic medical records needing to be collected from our community health partners. Onboard study patients onto our software platformClearly explain the study objectives with users over video calls and instruct them on downloading the study software to their smartphones Build rapport with users by utilizing skilled communication to create a safe and trusting environment Safeguard the confidentiality of our users Maintain accurate records of interviews and user communications on our computer database - REDCap Answer questions participants ask over email Managing and executing administrative tasksMaintain a log of medical records (EHRs) that need to be retrieved from our community health partners Pull user health records from Electronic Health export systems following HIPAA compliance guidelines and safeguarding user confidentiality Attend project meetings (all virtual/remote via phone or video) Manage and promptly respond to all project related phone calls and emails Research relevant grant and funding opportunities Perform miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned 6+ months of relevant experience (as a research/administrative assistant and/or customer support role) Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Detail-oriented perfectionist who is highly organized. You must be able to handle many emails, phone calls, and video chats daily. Ability to manage multiple incoming requests while ensuring they are relayed or handled at the appropriate time, in the appropriate order and in a correct manner. Must be comfortable with remote, virtual roles and limited face-time. Experience conducting onboarding interviews with study participants Human Subjects Training Certification Experience with REDCap and HIPAA compliance Familiarity with Android OS systems Well-familiarized with Google Apps / G-Suite (e.g. Gmail, G-Cal, Google Drive/Docs/Sheets/Forms) Ability to quickly learn new software. At Aware Healthcare you can expect much more than just a competitive hourly rate. Here are some of the many benefits you can expect as part of your internship experience: Early-stage startup experience: you'll get in on the ground floor of a new digital healthcare company and experience true innovation first-hand. Portfolio projects: you'll be given the freedom, trust, and resources you need to own projects from start to finish that directly impact people's lives. Summer case study: at the end of the program, we'll help you create/publish a case study showcasing your summer projects for future employers (here's an example (https://medium.com/the-mission/deconstructing-data-science-breaking-the-complex-craft-into-its-simplest-parts-15b15420df21)). Letter of recommendation: by the end of the summer, your direct supervisor will write a personal letter of recommendation for you to use in future job applications. Future job referrals: for months after your internship, you'll have exclusive access to work opportunities that arise in our groups' 300+ company network. Professional mentorship: you'll receive direct training, guidance, and oversight from a supervisor who has 5+ years of experience in your chosen field of work. Networking opportunities: you'll meet and work alongside incredibly smart, driven, and resourceful teammates; build relationships that last your whole career. Real impact: you'll walk away from the summer with having positively influenced the trajectory of people in recovery, and tangible work products that prove it.  Aware Healthcare is on a mission to build the “thermometer for the mind”: a digital medical device that delivers real-time measures of clinical risk to providers, about their patients, at the moments they need it most. The current gold-standard of evaluation in psychiatry are pen & paper surveys that provide subjective, episodic, high-burden, and clinic-based measures of risk. Our thermometer allows providers to check the ‘mental temperature' of their patients — in an objective, continuous, ecological, and passive fashion — at any time. With our thermometer, providers know who needs help, and when they need it. Not only does this shine light into the black box that currently defines life outside the clinic, but it allows providers to deliver just-in-time interventions to patients before it's too late. Trust in providers grows when patients know they're being looked out for. Population health flourishes when high-risk gets detected early. Per capita costs plummet when rates of readmission are reduced. Welcome to the triple-aim of healthcare. We envision a world where we all have the vocabulary to describe how we're mentally feeling; self-awareness to identify when we're heading down a dark path; and tools to get help in minutes not weeks. We can't manage what we don't measure, so we see no more important problem than this for technology in healthcare. We are starting with addiction for several reasons. For one, it seems we've all been affected by or lost friends and family who have struggled with this chronic disease. Two, addiction is the most costly, preventable, and unmanaged disease in America; costing our nation over $700 billion per year and leading to over 70 other comorbid medical conditions. Three, most digital health companies have run away from addiction, because they see the problem as ‘too hard'; the patients as ‘unmanageable'; the suffering as ‘inevitable'. With over 16% of Americans meeting criteria for clinical addiction, and another 32% classifying as risky users, we see this as too big of a problem to ignore. Join us in redefining what it means to know thyself, reconsidering how we measure population health, and revolutionizing the way we manage mental healthcare. Join us at Aware Healthcare. We're a small team looking for someone who's passionate about democratizing self-knowledge; relentless about getting help to those who need it most. You should be comfortable exploring outside your comfort zone; be ready to learn and constantly take on new challenges. You should be known by your colleagues for never compromising on quality, while always moving quickly. On our team, no one is expected to know everything, but everyone is expected to be capable of learning independently, and applying that knowledge effectively. This is a fast-paced role with many concurrent responsibilities, and it comes with a great deal of ownership. Chances are you will grow more in this role than any other role of your career. This idea should excite you, rather than scare you. Being on the Aware Healthcare team means you... Take ownership: the buck stops at you; you are individually responsible. Are proactive: you take initiative; identify problems before they happen. Embrace risk: take courageous & calculated risks; no one gets banished for making mistakes. Are radically candid: you expect truth and nothing but the truth; give & take constructive criticism. Have a growth-mindset: we believe you can always be better & you should too; no one has ever ‘made it'. Are insatiably curious: you have a desire to understand the world that can never be fully satisfied. Practice humility: you don't know everything and you never will; embrace that and learn. Focus on humans: always feel into the human experience at the other end of the machine. Are playful: you work hard, laugh hard, and crack jokes in meetings. Think slow: you choose careful deliberation over brash decisions.

Title: Research Associate/Sr. Research Associate
Text: Job Description Pacific BioLabs (PBL), Northern California’s Service Leader in Bioscience Testing, is an independent contract laboratory offering cGMP/GLP services in toxicology, biocompatibility, pharmacology, analytical chemistry, and microbiology. PBL has been serving the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and medical device industries for over 25 years and is committed to helping its Clients deliver lifesaving medicines and medical devices to physicians and patients who need them. PBL has an immediate opening for a full time Research Associate/Senior Research Associate in the Analytical Services Department to support analytical and bioanalytical testing. This position will report to the Director, Bioanalytical Services. Candidates with cGMP experience are strongly encouraged to apply. The Research Associate/Senior Research Associate is expected to develop, validate, and implement a variety of GMP/GLP analytical /bioanalytical studies including ELISA, MSD-ECLA, SDS-PAGE, Spectroscopy, HPLC, and other similar test methods. Relevant experience working on PK and/or ADA testing is a plus. Primary responsibilities: Play an active role in the development and validation of Client GMP/GLP analytical /bioanalytical methods including ELISA, MSD-ECLA, SDS-PAGE, Spectroscopy, and HPLC. Perform laboratory testing to support Analytical Services workflow in accordance with Client/Sponsor deadlines/timelines. Perform critical review of data for technical content and regulatory compliance. Preparation of Client/Sponsor reports, Methods, and/or Standard Operating Procedures. Ensuring analytical/bioanalytical equipment is maintained in good working order that includes troubleshooting and performing minor repairs as needed. Required Skills Must be able to effectively operate in an evolving complex and dynamic environment. Must be a motivated individual capable of working in a fast-paced environment to produce quality and timely results. Must be able to understand Client/Sponsor needs and build relationships as required to meet their goals and objectives. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Familiarity with Microsoft Word and Excel and laboratory-based data and quality management systems. Qualifications Candidates with a strong understanding of bioanalytical procedures and relevant GMP experience preferred. Experience in the operation, minor maintenance, and calibration of laboratory equipment highly desired. A Master’s Degree in Biochemistry, Protein Chemistry, or related field with 2+ years of experience. A Bachelor’s Degree in Biochemistry, Protein Chemistry, or related field with 3-4 years of experience. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Day shift Holidays Monday to Friday Overtime Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

Title: Lab Assistant
Text: renegade.bio is an agile team of science, technology, and logistics experts, mobilizing in the public interest to make fast, safe, regular coronavirus testing accessible to all. Our RenegadeXP™ COVID-19 testing methodology gives organizations responsible for public health the ability to rapidly scale up capacity for widespread ongoing testing. In collaboration with other CLIA-certified labs, researchers, and organizations across the ecosystem of public health, we are working day and night with a singular goal: to make COVID-19 testing accessible to every person on the planet, regardless of income. We are looking for a highly motivated, independent but collaborative minded Laboratory Assistant. This is a full-time, daytime shift position. Principal duties and responsibilities Perform laboratory tests including pre- and post-analytic phases Prepare samples/specimens Produce accurate and reliable data and interpret results Follow methodologies in carrying routine tasks Research relevant topics and gather information/data Adhere to correct procedures, policies and health/safety guidelines Keep abreast of all industry developments and best practices Document all activities, record results and insert/retrieve data Maintain work area and equipment Provide administrative assistance Education and Qualifications 3+ years diagnostic lab experience Bachelor's degree in in biotechnology, biology or a related field is preferred Familiarity with automated laboratory equipment Computer literacy and experience with Laboratory Information Systems Accuracy and close attention to detail Strong analytical judgement Verbal and written communication skills Research and analysis skills Experience working with lab equipment Job Type: Full-time Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour Benefits: Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift Day shift Monday to Friday Weekends Experience: Laboratory: 3 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Work Location: One location This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Company's website: www.renegade.bio Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/renegad3bio Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No
