Title: Core Java Engineer - Engineering Services
Text: Company Description: Quartet is a pioneering healthcare technology company striving to improve the lives of people with mental health conditions. We connect people to a personalized care team to get them the right care at the right time. Our collaborative technology platform and range of services bring together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive down healthcare costs. Backed by $153MM in venture funding from top investors like Oak HC/FT, GV (formerly Google Ventures), F-Prime Capital Partners, Polaris Partners, and Centene Corporation. Quartet is headquartered in NYC and is currently operating in several markets across the United States \u2014 Pennsylvania, Washington, Northern California, New Jersey, North Carolina, Louisiana, and Illinois. About the team & Opportunity: Quartet is looking for an experienced, mission-driven Software Development Engineer in Test - or, SDET - to help us design and build a world-class platform that enables every person in our society to thrive by providing a collaborative behavioral and physical health ecosystem. You will have the opportunity to join a diverse and growing team of talented people who genuinely love what they do. Additionally, we encourage all team members to take ownership of emerging problem areas and empower people to work autonomously as we focus on delivering meaningful results to our valued customers. SDETs at Quartet are core software engineers who understand all aspects of quality in the software development lifecycle and who will spend the majority of their time developing code in our automated quality platform. You might even consider yourself to be a full-stack SDET. For us, this means having a strong understanding of an application's functional, usability, performance, and security characteristics. This will be developed as you work directly with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers on new and improved features for our customer-facing applications. Additionally, you will make decisions as to the strategies and technologies we use with the understanding that we must find the appropriate balance of productivity, velocity, agility, and quality. We're looking for someone who can quickly understand the architecture of the Quartet applications and platform and test the web services and features within this ecosystem by building a robust test infrastructure that will be used to drive positive health outcomes and improve people's lives in a tangible way. As Quartet's SDET, you will establish processes and tools by which our applications and services, across the stack, can be tested to vet their internal functionality and end to end functionality as a means to ensure confidence that our software solutions operate as expected and that regressions are not taking place. You'll build and implement testing frameworks, automated request replay systems, front end to back end test suites, and provide tools to the greater engineering team to fully own their systems, which include their ability to create tests that guarantee their functionality. Accountabilities: Work with Product and Engineering to identify high-value areas to test Work with Product to write test plans for features Work with Engineering to coordinate releases and testing Write Integration and Functional (end-to-end) tests Work with Security Engineering to define and write security tests  Establish processes and tools by which our applications and services, across the stack, can be tested automatically. Support and maintenance of tools provided to the rest of the engineering team so that testing responsibilities are distributed to all engineers Minimum Qualifications: Experience in Java or compatible language.   Several years experience managing and/or contributing to comprehensive functional and integration test suites from design, implementation, and maintenance of test automation and frameworks. Comprehensive knowledge of unit, integration and functional testing strategies Direct experience with the Selenium ecosystem of tools and libraries Understanding of Behavior Driven Development practices. Experience with browser test automation using tools like Selenium. Experience with performance, scalability, and reliability testing methodologies of distributed systems. Subscribe to the 'security vulnerabilities are bugs that should be tested like all other bugs' philosophy Employee Benefits for Quartet include: Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, catered lunches, snacks, team events and outings, mental healthcare coverage of 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements, medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental leave, commuter benefits, 401K, stock option grants, gym benefits. Company Description: Quartet is a pioneering healthcare technology company striving to improve the lives of people with mental health conditions. We connect people to a personalized care team to get them the right care at the right time. Our collaborative technology platform and range of services bring together physicians, mental health providers, and insurance companies to effectively improve patient outcomes and drive down healthcare costs. Backed by $153MM in venture funding from top investors like Oak HC/FT, GV (formerly Google Ventures), F-Prime Capital Partners, Polaris Partners, and Centene Corporation. Quartet is headquartered in NYC and is currently operating in several markets across the United States — Pennsylvania, Washington, Northern California, New Jersey, North Carolina, Louisiana, and Illinois. About the team & Opportunity: Quartet is looking for an experienced, mission-driven Software Development Engineer in Test - or, SDET - to help us design and build a world-class platform that enables every person in our society to thrive by providing a collaborative behavioral and physical health ecosystem. You will have the opportunity to join a diverse and growing team of talented people who genuinely love what they do. Additionally, we encourage all team members to take ownership of emerging problem areas and empower people to work autonomously as we focus on delivering meaningful results to our valued customers. SDETs at Quartet are core software engineers who understand all aspects of quality in the software development lifecycle and who will spend the majority of their time developing code in our automated quality platform. You might even consider yourself to be a full-stack SDET. For us, this means having a strong understanding of an application's functional, usability, performance, and security characteristics. This will be developed as you work directly with Product Managers, Designers, and Engineers on new and improved features for our customer-facing applications. Additionally, you will make decisions as to the strategies and technologies we use with the understanding that we must find the appropriate balance of productivity, velocity, agility, and quality. We're looking for someone who can quickly understand the architecture of the Quartet applications and platform and test the web services and features within this ecosystem by building a robust test infrastructure that will be used to drive positive health outcomes and improve people's lives in a tangible way. As Quartet's SDET, you will establish processes and tools by which our applications and services, across the stack, can be tested to vet their internal functionality and end to end functionality as a means to ensure confidence that our software solutions operate as expected and that regressions are not taking place. You'll build and implement testing frameworks, automated request replay systems, front end to back end test suites, and provide tools to the greater engineering team to fully own their systems, which include their ability to create tests that guarantee their functionality. Experience with browser test automation using tools like Selenium. Experience with performance, scalability, and reliability testing methodologies of distributed systems. Subscribe to the 'security vulnerabilities are bugs that should be tested like all other bugs' philosophy Employee Benefits for Quartet include: Unlimited vacation, volunteer opportunities, catered lunches, snacks, team events and outings, mental healthcare coverage of 15 free therapy sessions + unlimited copay reimbursements, medical, dental + vision coverage, generous parental leave, commuter benefits, 401K, stock option grants, gym benefits.

Title: Senior Application Engineer, Backend
Text: Come work alongside some of the most talented minds in the agtech industry. We are a team of innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. You will be given the opportunity to work with an amazing group of people who care about each other and their work.    What we are looking for: At Arable we operate at the intersection of innovative connected hardware, data science, and recommendation systems; and at the center of all of these are the data systems that run our IoT, ML, and application systems. We're building a backend system for our specialized hardware which provides in-field monitoring for agricultural solutions. Our fleet is expanding and we're pushing new technologies like NB-IoT and edge-based machine learning. If you\u2019re motivated by working on complex technical problems, and driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you. Come help build the future of agriculture! What we do: At Arable, our goal is to connect all the world\u2019s farms and provide the highest-quality data to power predictive analytics that will help optimize the global food system. This is an ambitious goal, but the need has never been greater to rethink how we will feed an ever-growing population and reduce our impact on natural resources. We believe the heart of the solution is digitizing the analog world with high-fidelity data to help food producers optimize their operations. If successful, we hope the impact of our work will improve the lives of farmers everywhere and be a major contribution to securing the global food supply for decades to come.  A few examples of the work we\u2019re doing today:  Helping farmers in India and China through improved insights into crop development Giving produce growers in California the tools to optimize production with less waste Helping irrigated farmers in Nebraska manage water more efficiently and sustainably to protect our water supply What you will do: As a senior member of our backend engineering team you're responsible for: Being part of a team to implement a scalable cloud-based IoT backend for devices from around the world Engineering functionality around fleet management and device ownership Creating end-to-end testing infrastructure alongside our Firmware and QA teams Advising and architecting reliable and secure systems Improving our IoT data pipeline for handling higher throughput and resiliency What you bring: Required Qualifications: 2+ Years in recent IoT platform development  8+ Years in developing applications Python, Java, C/C++, Scala, or Go 4+ Years of developing cloud services and infrastructure An understanding of networking fundamentals and secure communications Hands-on experience with relational databases and large data Team player with excellent verbal and written communication skills BSCS, MSCS, or Ph.D. in CS or equivalent experience  Preferred Qualifications: Experience working with AWS IoT Platform  Experience with IoT or M2M industry (i.e. home automation, business automation, health, smart utilities, etc.) Experience with Postgres Experience with Terraform or related cloud infrastructure tool Experience with MQTT/COAP protocols Experience with x.509 client certificates Experience with RTOS a plus (not required) What we offer: At Arable you will be joining a company of dedicated team players who bring together diverse expertise and a passion for building a more sustainable future. We are a fast-moving startup committed to providing a rewarding employee experience through the work we do, the team, compensation, and benefits including: Excellent medical, dental, vision, life, disability benefits, and a 401k program Flexible PTO A focus on community involvement and career development Being an intricate part of creating an excellent IoT product in the Agtech space and having a positive impact on the world we live in. At Arable, we don't just accept difference\u2014we celebrate and support it. Not only because it's the right thing to do, but because we draw on the differences in who we are, what we've experienced, and how we think to make Arable thrive. Arable is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations. Title: Associate Business Systems Analyst (Salesforce)
Text: OpenGov is a mission driven fast-growth, Series D, venture backed startup (includes Andreessen Horowitz, Formation 8, Thrive Capital, and Emerson Collective). Our Board of Directors includes iconic Silicon Valley executives John Chambers (former Cisco Chairman and CEO) and Marc Andreessen (Time Magazine\u2019s list of the 100 most influential people in the world).   We have surpassed 1,000+ governments (and growing fast!) using our products in our mission to power more effective and accountable government. Check out the latest article about us: OpenGov continues record growth with expanded cloud offering, growing customer base, and accelerated hiring Position Responsibilities: You will work alongside key stakeholders (Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, Professional Services, Support, etc.), and you\u2019ll directly see and feel the tangible value of your work on our team to drive company growth and efficiency.  This role will focus on project management and GTM application administration for projects that improve and sustain our GTM team\u2019s case, phone, and integration systems.\nDevelop a deep understanding of the OpenGov business (Integrations, data flows, data integrity) A typical work week might comprise of: 70% GTM Systems Administration Enable business partners to self-service their data needs through documentation and template reports/dashboards Create streamlined workflows to drive quality and ease of use by simplifying page layouts, reports, and dashboards  Serve as lead on database enhancement within Salesforce (contacts, systems, and mass data at the account and contact level) Be the \u201cclicks not code\u201d in Salesforce, mantra, but know when code is the right approach 30% Strategic Projects Lead projects that improve day-to-day operations and long-term strategy for GTM systems (Outreach, Mavenlink, Marketo, Gong, Leadlander, Govwin, etc.) Facilitate requirements gathering sessions with business partners as we analyze and prioritize business needs Employ superb written and meeting skills to quickly resolve discovered issues or perceived bottlenecks Be the source of truth for project status and work to make overall progress (or lack thereof) transparent Ensure successful adoption with the right amount of documentation for the current and future state of business processes Additional Professional Development: Find the intersection between your personal development interests and our business needs to identify side projects Grow your skills by completing classes from Linkedin Learning Stay proficient in our internal Salesforce and Data Infrastructure ecosystems Role Requirements: 1-3 year of work experience, preferably in a SaaS organization Relevant Salesforce Admin certifications are a plus Examples of Salesforce administration/configuration work for example workflow rules, process builder, reporting, etc. Presentation, meeting planning, and communication experience across various audiences (in-team, cross-team, executive, etc.) Experience with a CRM (Salesforce, SugarCRM, SAP) is a plus, Salesforce Preferred What makes OpenGov unique \u00bb Leadership: CEO Zac Bookman (MPA from Harvard and JD from Yale) is truly a mission driven CEO. He was named one of the 100 most Intriguing Entrepreneurs by Goldman Sachs and SF Business Times' 40 under 40 class of 2018! \u00bb Funding: $140 million, Series D company, from top tier investors including Andreessen Horowitz, 8VC, Thrive Capital, and Emerson Collective. Just look at www.opengov.com/careers  \u00bb Product: Named a Tech Pioneer by the World Economic Forum, our cloud solution leverages cutting-edge technology to innovate on the core processes of Government. \u00bb Mission Driven: We are a technology company helping out our communities, cities, and states. Title: Manager, Spatial Analyst for Natural Climate Solutions
Text: Conservation International (CI) has been protecting nature for the benefit of all for over 30 years. Through science, policy, and partnerships, CI is helping build a healthier, more prosperous and more productive planet.   POSITION SUMMARY The Catalyst team within the Center for Natural Climate Solutions conducts high impact, innovative and applied research in support of advancing climate change mitigation science. The team employs a range of spatial analysis and modeling techniques that uses remote sensing and GIS technologies. We are looking for a Spatial Analyst Manager to collaborate on activities to identify, prioritize, map, design, and implement natural climate solutions (NCS). This work on NCS will contribute towards achieving the Paris climate agreement of keeping global temperatures below 2 C and span all NCS pathways from protection and restoration of natural ecosystems, to improved management of working forests and farms. The position will conduct both geospatial analyses and field science in support of a range of research studies applied to unlock NCS at local, national, and global scales. The successful candidate may also lead and support other geospatial modeling analyses involving the mission of Conservation International and fill other roles as needed for the success of the team, such as project management and coordination, communications, and managing partnerships.   RESPONSIBILITIES Collaborate on the development and implementation of spatial analysis and tools that advance natural climate solutions (NCS). Acquisition of data (geospatial and field) in support of NCS research and its associated data management and curation, analysis, and communication/visualization. Support and lead the development of associated reports and peer-review publications from NCS research. Identify opportunities for NCS research and projects working with country programs. Produce maps for national and project-level planning related to carbon outcomes from NCS interventions. Manage highly visible, complex technical projects and/or partnerships within CI. Manage external partner relationships, including convening expert stakeholders from peer organizations and, more broadly, as necessary, to accelerate delivery of the above workstreams. Communicate scientific information and data in graphically compelling maps and interactive platforms. Other duties as assigned by supervisor WORKING CONDITIONS This position is based in the Arlington, VA office of Conservation International; however, other locations may be considered, either in the US or in countries with CI offices. Work is performed in a typical office environment, and with potential for work from home office. Some travel \u2013 up to 25%, often in developing countries. Flexibility in work schedule required in order to accommodate time differences between the Arlington, VA office and international field offices located in multiple time zones. This is a two-year fixed term position. QUALIFICATIONS Required Master's degree in environmental science, climate science, geography, or related fields. 4-6 years work experience in scientific research and/or managing conservation or research projects or initiatives. Proficient in programming languages (e.g., Python, Javacript, R), and GIS software applications (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS, google earth engine). Experience in processing remotely sensed imagery (e.g., satellites, airborne) that contain optical, radar, and lidar data. Demonstrated ability to collect data, conduct analysis, and interpret results for a scientific audience through peer-reviewed publications and other mediums. Experience in graphically communicating scientific data (e.g., maps, interactive dashboards). Proven team player able to work effectively across cultures and within and across organizations. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Highly organized and strong attention to detail and experience with work-flow documentation (e.g., Github). Demonstrated problem solving skills and ability to build on existing knowledge to develop new approaches. Preferred Proven technical expertise using a range of geospatial information systems, remote sensing techniques, image sources, and analysis of large datasets. Proven technical skills in programming (e.g. Javascript or Python, R), data processing, and statistical and geographical analysis. Proven experience in ecological field methods (especially forest ecosystems), including design and implementation of field plot inventory methods and including the processing and analysis of primary field data. Skilled in using software systems (e.g. Erdas, Esri, R, GDAL, IDRISI, Google Earth Engine), terminology, and procedures and in leveraging new applications. Demonstrated knowledge of relevant climate and carbon science literature. Ability to work independently and with minimal guidance. Spanish and/or Portuguese language skills. To apply for this position please submit a Resume or CV and Cover Letter. See all Conservation International Career Opportunities HERE Conservation International Values We expect that all employees will embrace the values of our organization.\u200b Passion: Inspired by people and by nature, we are urgently compelled to drive change for a sustainable future.  Integrity: We are honest, transparent and accountable for our actions. Teamwork: We work together as one CI,\u202frecognizing that\u202finclusion, collaboration and\u202fcooperation are\u202ffundamental to achieving a\u202fhealthy and prosperous\u202fworld for all. Respect: We respect each other and work to earn trust, valuing our\u202fdiversity of cultures, talents, and experiences. Courage: We pursue our vision, taking bold action, persevering and overcoming challenges. Optimism: We are optimistic about the capacity of people to be caring, generous and brilliant, and believe that with partners, we can inspire humanity to create a better future. Title: Business Analyst, IT
Text: Do you know what gets us up in the morning? Justice. (We literally have that phrase plastered on our coffee mugs. That's how zealous we are). We envision a society that respects the dignity of every single person and are fighting to realize this every day. To tackle the most pressing injustices of our day. To explicitly, pointedly and effectively reduce the burdens of the justice system on people of color. To secure equal justice, end mass incarceration, and strengthen families and communities around the country. Who we are The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, envisions a society that respects the dignity of every person and safeguards justice for everyone. Vera is committed to securing equal justice, ending mass incarceration, and strengthening families and communities. We study problems that impede human dignity and justice. We pilot solutions that are transformative and achievable. We engage diverse communities in informed debate. We harness the power of evidence to drive effective policy and practice. We work with others who share our vision to tackle the most pressing injustices of our day\u2014from mass incarceration, racial disparities, and the loss of public trust in law enforcement to the unmet needs of the vulnerable, the marginalized, and those harmed by crime and violence. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, Los Angeles, and New Orleans. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace\u2014specifically, we value diverse experiences with regard to educational background and justice system contact. We hire employees that reflect our values: respect, independence, collaboration, and commitment. What you'll do IT Business Analysts play a pivotal role in technology transformation projects carried out by our team and are expected to use technology and business analysis knowledge to successfully and independently complete technology and business projects.  We are ideally looking for someone who also has evolved in project management offices, is well versed in project governance and IT project management methodologies, standards, policies, processes and procedures. Someone who can carry out the work and turn in all artifacts required through project life cycles based on different project management methodologies ( e.g. Agile, Waterfall).  Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Working with partners and team members to elicit requirements that capture organization needs. Clearly understanding, articulating, documenting, analyzing, researching and proposing solutions to business requirements. Understanding and recognizing obstacles to achieving business results and ensuring that the appropriate mitigating actions are being taken to resolve any impediments. Participating in the discussion and decisions regarding project methodology, processes and technology solutions. Participating in project phase reviews (e.g. design reviews and walk-throughs) to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions Owning project delivery artifacts being generated throughout analysis, design, build, test, implementation and production support. Managing ongoing relationship with business partners to improving satisfaction with IT delivery. Coordinating project delivery by participating in design reviews and walkthroughs to communicate systems designs and validating proposed solutions. Working with vendors to define statements of work, manages relationships, and monitoring vendor deliverables to ensure quality and a positive business outcome Providing Test management, project management and change management for projects including the creation of work plans, backlogs, communication and change management plans, running project meetings, creating status reports, and tracking risks, issues, and action items. Creating training materials and leading training delivery. Analyzing practices and processes to ensure effective use of Information Technology services and new solutions. Other duties as assigned What you bring Belief in advancing a just, fair and equitable society, with a specific focus on racial justice. A Bachelor\u2019s degree is required. Master\u2019s degree preferred. A degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or experience in a related field is preferred.  A minimum of 5 years professional experience required. Broad IT domain experience in two or more of the following areas IT areas: Applications Development, Architecture, Project Management, or Quality Assurance. Previous Agile framework experience acting as a Product Owner providing coaching to business staff for story development. A good understanding of knowledge Management technologies. Knowledge of project management principles and methodology. Professional and effective written and oral communication skills. Able to effectively converse with, listen to, and collaborate with all levels of users to understand their environment and the impact of system changes. Self-starter with initiative who can manage multiple tasks and adapt and respond quickly to opportunities for increased and more effective services. Able to apply principles, practices, and procedures and complete moderately complex assignments with knowledge of Business Systems Analysis. Understanding of policy and the application of policies to Information Technology activities. Experience working with Project management and workflow tools (ie: Smartsheets), large SharePoint migrations (Intranet and/or other) and software development and/or strategy advisory is a plus.  Experience with Smartsheets or similar workflow and project management tools, Lucid chart or similar process diagramming tools, Online 365, Zendesk or similar helpdesk queue tools is a plus. To apply Please submit cover letter and resume. The cover letter should outline your minimum and additional qualifications and address how you will use those qualifications to excel in the role. Applications will be considered on a rolling basis until position is filled.  Submission online through Vera\u2019s website is preferred. However, if necessary, materials may be mailed or faxed to: ATTN: Human Resources / IT Business Analyst 34 35th St, Suite 4-2A, Brooklyn, NY 11232  Fax: (212) 941-9407 Please use only one method (online, mail or fax) of submission. No phone calls or emails, please. Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Vera is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, citizenship status, current employment status, or caregiver status. Vera works to advance justice, particularly racial justice, in an increasingly multicultural country and globally connected world. We value diverse experiences, including with regard to educational background and justice system contact, and depend on a diverse staff to carry out our mission. Do you know what gets us up in the morning? Justice. (We literally have that phrase plastered on our coffee mugs. That's how zealous we are). We envision a society that respects the dignity of every single person and are fighting to realize this every day. To tackle the most pressing injustices of our day. To explicitly, pointedly and effectively reduce the burdens of the justice system on people of color. To secure equal justice, end mass incarceration, and strengthen families and communities around the country. Who we are The Vera Institute of Justice, founded in 1961, envisions a society that respects the dignity of every person and safeguards justice for everyone. Vera is committed to securing equal justice, ending mass incarceration, and strengthening families and communities. We study problems that impede human dignity and justice. We pilot solutions that are transformative and achievable. We engage diverse communities in informed debate. We harness the power of evidence to drive effective policy and practice. We work with others who share our vision to tackle the most pressing injustices of our day—from mass incarceration, racial disparities, and the loss of public trust in law enforcement to the unmet needs of the vulnerable, the marginalized, and those harmed by crime and violence. Vera has offices in New York City, Washington, DC, Los Angeles, and New Orleans. Vera is an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to diversity in the workplace—specifically, we value diverse experiences with regard to educational background and justice system contact. We hire employees that reflect our values: respect, independence, collaboration, and commitment. What you'll do IT Business Analysts play a pivotal role in technology transformation projects carried out by our team and are expected to use technology and business analysis knowledge to successfully and independently complete technology and business projects.  We are ideally looking for someone who also has evolved in project management offices, is well versed in project governance and IT project management methodologies, standards, policies, processes and procedures. Someone who can carry out the work and turn in all artifacts required through project life cycles based on different project management methodologies ( e.g. Agile, Waterfall).  Specific responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Working with partners and team members to elicit requirements that capture organization needs. Clearly understanding, articulating, documenting, analyzing, researching and proposing solutions to business requirements. Understanding and recognizing obstacles to achieving business results and ensuring that the appropriate mitigating actions are being taken to resolve any impediments. Title: Data Analyst (Temporary)
Text: The Position: Lead/facilitate implementation of business intelligence system for client data management \u2013 bridging data from Link2Feed and other agency systems; creation of data analytics/visualization for FH/GCFB management to turn data into actionable insights; educate/train FH/GCFB staff. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Implementation Learn and maintain expertise in the business intelligence software used by the food banks Support food banks in the use of business intelligence software Reporting Coordinate and communicate between food banks, other data owners, and the business intelligence software organization Build and maintain tabular and/or visualization reports for regular and/or automated reporting and analysis Support the food banks with ad hoc reporting Analysis Work alongside teams within the food banks to understand operational and strategic needs Work with a variety of data sources - extracting knowledge and actionable information Identify patterns and trends in data sets Administration Help form data management and governance processes Build processes to catch data integrity issues Identify opportunities to improve data and food bank processes Define new data collection and analysis processes Document processes Perform data validation/quality assurance analysis Train food bank personnel on the skills needed to maintain data analytic processes Demonstrate and support the Gleaners and Forgotten Harvest missions, visions and values. Application Process: For a full job description click here. Title: Business Analyst
Text: Are you a skilled Analyst who believes in lending your skills to end hunger? If so, consider being the Business Analyst for the San Francisco Marin Food Bank. The SF Marin Food Bank is comprised of a dedicated team of approximately 150 staff working collaboratively to provide close to 50 million pounds of food to over 210,000 people in the Bay Area \u2013 a region where 1 in 4 people are at risk of hunger. We are currently looking for a Business Analyst to help with overseeing data architecture of its ERP that delivers against the organizations mission to end hunger. See the job description below and apply today if you would like to join us in our mission to end hunger. POSITION PURPOSE Work with key stakeholders to align the business needs of the Food Bank and the functionality and data architecture of its ERP (Microsoft Dynamics NAV 2016) and associated databases including a SQL data warehouse. Implement process improvements to increase efficiencies by utilizing new or additional features within the applications ecosystem. Create reports and queries using tools such as Jet Reports/Jet Analytics. Support various departments with their ERP use and act as a liaison between functional teams, the IT department, and external vendors as needed for emerging business needs, projects, and troubleshooting. Coordinate with external vendors responsible for ERP system customizations, upgrades, and Tier 2 user support. Prepare process and user training documentation and provide end-user training. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES Coordinate all aspects of ERP database operations, including implementation, custom design, and development (executed by external vendor), user security, documentation, etc. Work with internal stakeholders to understand business requirements, define scope of potential changes, propose technical and/or process options, create and deploy selected solutions. Troubleshoot user issues; work with external vendor on resolution if needed. Develop and maintain system documentation, including documentation of any custom code or integrations, system logic and flow charts, and version upgrades. Work with stakeholders to develop training materials and conduct user training. Directly manage vendor relationships including Dynamics NAV VAR and third-party vendors. Develop and publish standard reports. Work with users to develop ad-hoc reports and queries.  Experience with Jet Reports preferred. Develop and maintain a broad understanding of organizational processes, procedures, challenges, and initiatives. Propose and implement data base tools and procedures to support those organizational needs. Provide technical knowledge and implementation support for integration of the ERP with other systems. Maintain peer relationships with other food banks, represent organization in Operations & Technology  Consortium, advise senior leadership on network-wide issues related to areas of focus and expertise. Other duties as assigned QUALIFICATIONS Combination of education and relevant experience sufficient to perform essential duties. 2-5 years\u2019 experience with finance, operations, and inventory transactions and procedures in an ERP system Understanding of database theory, programming logic, and business procedures. Demonstrated analysis skills including expert-level proficiency in Excel; proficiency in other Microsoft Office Suite applications Strong organizational skills with ability to utilize initiative and judgment in juggling multiple responsibilities in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment Demonstrated ability to be thoughtful and innovative in analyzing organizational needs and communicating complex data and systems solutions to stakeholders. Professional, accountable, and results-oriented with the ability to work independently while supporting multiple stakeholders Proven ability to work remotely Experience with Microsoft SQL Experience in object-oriented programming environment helpful (preferably Visual Basic) Ability to work and interact well with individuals (staff, volunteers, and participants) from a variety of socioeconomic backgrounds in a culturally diverse environment Comfortable and well-versed in interacting with a broad range of end users with varying technical abilities. Preferred experience with Food Banking, food industry, supply chain or related inventory/warehouse environments Excellent written and verbal communication skills Interest in hunger or food issues PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT: (The physical and environmental demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.) ENVIRONMENT:    Standard office FINGER DEXTERITY:     Requires typing on standard computer. TALKING:     Ability to speak on phone and face to face. HEARING:    Able to hear average or normal conversations and receive ordinary information.  REPETITIVE MOTIONS:     Frequent and regular movements using the wrists, hands, and fingers. AVERAGE VISUAL ABILITIES:__    Average, ordinary, visual acuity necessary to view computer screens and documents. PHYSICAL STRENGTH:     NOT APPLICABLE. COMMUNICATION AND COGNITIVE REQUIREMENTS REASONING ABILITY:      Ability to apply principles of logical or scientific thinking to a wide    range of intellectual and practical problems.  Ability to interpret instructions. MATHEMATICS ABILITY:     Ability to perform basic math skills, use decimals to compute ratios and percentages, and to draw and interpret graphs. LANGUAGE ABILITY:    Fluency in English. Demonstrated excellence in writing and editing. SALARY:   Competitive pay based on qualifications and experience BENEFITS:    Medical, dental, life, long-term disability, and 403(b) retirement plan with employer base and matching contribution. Generous holidays, vacation, and sick time. The San Francisco-Marin Food Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Title: Research Informatics Analyst
Company: KU - Center for Public Partnerships and Research
Location: Lawrence, KS -- CAN BE REMOTE BASED
Text: KU-CPPR is seeking a qualified Research Informatics Analyst to join our team and be a part of our data science and technology efforts. Are you security conscious, detail oriented, willing to ask questions to get to the right solution, and able to critically think about application, server, and data security risks? Can you readily pick up new technical skills, adapt to changing needs, and identify and implement proven or novel solutions? We need someone who can review and process complex settings and make the right connections between the technical aspects of our applications and IT infrastructure and the kind of information we analyze, create, and publish for our partners. This position will manage our Tableau Server Application, coordinate and carry out Tableau Report publishing across our portfolio of initiatives, and provide technical administrative and informatics support for our other internal applications and data projects. CPPR specializes in research and evaluation, data science projects, and social innovation work that supports our mission to optimize the well-being of children, youth, and families. We are looking for individuals who are passionate about impacting social change for good through data and technology. The person in this position must be a critical go-between with internal and external partners to coordinate work, exercise judgment in identifying and developing solutions, and ensure we provide secure and monitored access to data on behalf of our partners. Required Qualifications: High school/GED and 3 years related experience OR Associate\u2019s degree with 2 years related experience OR Bachelor\u2019s degree in related field Technical experience in information technology, application management/development, or system administration as demonstrated in application materials and work experience Experience working with internal and external teams on technical solutions or applications as demonstrated in application materials and work experience Clear communication skills as demonstrated by application materials Attention to detail and accuracy as demonstrated by application materials Preferred Qualifications: Two or more years of experience administering or developing web-based applications and web-services, as demonstrated by application materials Two or more years of experience using R language to develop data sources or analytic codes, as demonstrated by application materials Experience with Tableau, R-Studio, or R-Shiny, as demonstrated by application materials Experience working on social science or research-related projects or teams, as demonstrated by application materials Experience supervising others to develop skills and carry out tasks, as demonstrated by application materials  KU-CPPR is seeking a qualified Research Informatics Analyst to join our team and be a part of our data science and technology efforts. Title: Measure of America Data and Research Intern
Text:
The Social Science Research Council (SSRC) is an independent, international, nonprofit organization devoted to the advancement of interdisciplinary research in the social sciences through a wide variety of workshops and conferences, fellowships and grants, summer training institutes, scholarly exchanges, research, and publications. For more information, please visit our website: www.ssrc.org. Measure of America is an initiative of the SSRC. We provide easy-to-use yet methodologically sound tools that measure what matters for human well-being, freedom, and opportunity. Through human development reports, thematic briefs, and interactive online maps and data visualization tools, we work with partners to breathe life into numbers, using data to create compelling narratives that foster understanding of inequalities and build support for people-centered policies. Our work is grounded in the strong conceptual framework of Amartya Sen’s capabilities approach. Much of our work centers on the American Human Development Index, a supplement to GDP and other money metrics, that tells the story of how ordinary Americans are faring. The Index, made up of health, education, and income indicators, is modeled after the United Nations Human Development Index, the global gold standard for measuring progress. Measure of America published the first-ever human development report for an affluent country in 2008, and has since released additional reports that explore well-being by state, congressional district, county, metro area, and census tract, as well as by gender, race and ethnicity, and nativity. DESCRIPTION Measure of America is seeking an intern for the 2020-2021 school year to assist in data research, data preparation for analysis, data cleaning, reports, and online tools. Preference will be given to current graduate students, though exemplary undergraduates will also be considered. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to participate in the development of future MOA reports and other products, be an integral member of a small, dynamic team, and gain practical experience in data extraction, cleaning, and translating data-based research into accessible documents for nonacademic audiences. The minimum time commitment is in the range of 10 to 15 hours per week (flexible around class schedule and other work commitments). A stipend will be provided. When possible, school credit will be given. RESPONSIBILITIES Duties for this internship include a diverse range of tasks, performed under the supervision of program staff, the exact mix of which will be determined based on the intern’s skills and interests. The chief areas of work are: 
participating in statistical research and data collection;
 
carrying out data calculations;
 
helping to contribute to the project’s online communications efforts;
 
conducting literature reviews on diverse topics in the social sciences and public policy.
 QUALIFICATIONS 
Undergraduate or graduate students in the social sciences, human rights, public policy, or international affairs (recent graduates will also be considered).
 
Demonstrated interest in domestic social policy issues.
 
Strong academic background and good writing skills.
 
Experience using data to make arguments desirable.
 
Knowledge of mapping software a plus.
 APPLICATION INFORMATION To apply, please submit your cover letter and resume. The Social Science Research Council is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are dedicated to equal employment opportunity and to cultivating and sustaining a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce. SSRC maintains a policy of nondiscrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. All aspects of employment with the Council are made on the basis of competence, skill and qualifications and will not be influenced in any manner by race, creed, color, religion, sex/gender, national origin/ancestry, ethnicity, age, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital or domestic partner status, medical conditions (including pregnancy and/or genetic information) or physical or mental disability, citizenship status, or any other categories prohibited by law. Title: Head of Information Technology
Company: The New York Stem Cell Foundation
Text: The New York Stem Cell Foundation (NYSCF) is a growing and successful nonprofit whose mission is to accelerate cures through stem cell research. We are looking for a motivated, hands-on, Head of Information Technology to join our growing staff to oversee the Information Technology for our high-tech, cutting edge life science environment. You will oversee the management, strategy, and execution of NYSCF's information technology (IT) operations and technical infrastructure, within established organizational requirements, specifications, costs and timelines. You will lead a team of outsourced IT support staff, determine IT requirements for information systems, manage the design, implementation and maintenance of the IT infrastructure, and reduce any identified security risks. You will have a detailed knowledge of industry best practices in IT management and processes. What you\u2019ll do: Develop strategy relating to NYSCF\u2019s Technology and IT infrastructure (computer and information systems, business applications, security, networks, and communication systems) aligned with established goals, strategy and organizational policies. Manage information technology and computer systems within NYSCF\u2019s operating environment by ensuring safe and secure configuration and operation with user needs and system functionality to contribute to organizational goals. Review, manage, develop, and implement organizational-wide policies and procedures associated with the use and safeguarding of technology and information systems within NYSCF\u2019s operating environment to ensure the security of data, network access, network availability, and network resiliency. Ensure implemented security controls are working and disaster recovery plans are in place such that our organization can resume business operations in a reasonable timeframe. Conduct security awareness training for all employees.  Implement and manage a Security Operations  Center (SOC), firewalls, IPS/IDS management, VPNs, and more. Use IaaS & SaaS-based strategies to create an outstanding approach for IT infrastructure services such as data storage, ID & Access Management, email & messaging, and data exchange among systems. Audit information systems, processes, and procedures and develop remediation plans to address any deficiencies found. Oversee our technology inventory and work with internal groups to proactively anticipate our organization's needs.  Communicate job expectations and perform performance appraisals of IT staff. Develop an annual IT budget and ensure it is managed and tracked cost-effectively. What we\u2019re looking for: Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field. An advanced degree is a plus. 8 -10 + years of experience working in IT operations, supervising technology teams, and overseeing large information technology projects. Experience with computer systems, security, network administration, network installation and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and telecommunications systems. Expertise in data governance. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to effectively communicate with teams across the entire organization. Excellent leadership and decision-making skills. Comfortable setting and maintaining IT policies across the organization. Advanced knowledge of project management principles. Comfortable working in both PC and MAC environmentsExperience with G Suite and Intermedia is a plus. Experience managing web-based applications such as AWS and Azure.   Understanding that this is a service provider role, have a can-do attitude and be very hands-on. Previous experience working in biotech, pharma, or scientific laboratories is a plus. The level is dependent on experience. We offer all full-time employees a comprehensive benefits package that goes into effect on the first of the month following your start date. Title: IS Data Engineer II
Text: We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our growing team of analytics experts. The hire will be responsible for expanding and optimizing our data warehouse and building data integrations, developing data best practices and governance, performing clinical and administrative reporting and data visualization, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The ideal candidate has been exposed to all aspects of data from multiple complex sources who enjoys optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up. The Data Engineer II will support our developers, database architects, data analysts and data scientists ensuring optimal data delivery architecture is consistent throughout ongoing projects. They will also support non-technical colleagues in the collection and appropriate use of clinical and non-clinical data. They must be self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. The right candidate will be excited by the prospect of optimizing or even re-designing our company\u2019s data architecture to support our next generation of products and data initiatives. Job Responsibilities Data Modeling \u2013 evaluate structured and unstructured data, determine the most appropriate schema for new fact tables, data marts, etc. Data Integration \u2013 incorporate new business and system data into the CHOP Data Warehouse while maintaining enterprise best practices and adhering to data governance standards. ETL \u2013 apply business rules to our data as we migrate from source to target using Informatica or scripting language. Validate data to ensure quality. Reporting \u2013 collaborate with colleagues across the enterprise to scope requests. Extract data from various data sources, validate results, create relevant data visualizations, and share with requester. Develop dashboards and automate refreshes as appropriate. Governance / Best Practices \u2013 adhere and contribute to enterprise data governance standards. Also educates and supports colleagues in best practices to ensure that data is used appropriately. Product Ownership \u2013 collaborate and act as the voice of the customer to offer concrete feedback and project requests as well as an advocate for analytics from within the business units themselves. Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources (including ground, hybrid cloud, and cloud) using SQL and various programming technologies. Develop analytics tools that utilize data resources to provide actionable insights, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Clinical, and Analyst teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Develop optimized tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing projects into an innovative industry leader. Proficient at integrating predictive and prescriptive models into applications and processes. Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. Make recommendations about platform adoption, including technology integrations, application servers, libraries, and frameworks. Participate in a shared production on-call support model. Be a critical part of an Agile Scrum software development team, ensuring the team successfully meets its deliverables each sprint. Required Licenses, Certifications, Registrations One (1) Certifications or proficiency in appropriate Data Science/Data Integration/Data Warehousing technology or subject domain. Required Education and Experience. Required Education: Bachelor\u2019s Degree in Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, Information Technology or related fields. Required Experience: Minimum of three (3) years of Data Engineering/Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing experience, preferably in a healthcare environment. Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable data stores. Previous experience manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets. Preferred Education, Experience & Cert/Lic Preferred Education: Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field. Preferred Experience: Minimum of six (6) years of experience in a Data Engineer role Additional Technical Requirements Strong analytic skills related to working with structured and unstructured datasets. Must possess critical thinking and creative problem solving skills along with the ability to communicate well with stakeholders throughout the organization. Strong communication, project management and organizational skills. Proficient in SQL Exposure to big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, BigSQL, Hive, etc. Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases, including IBM PDA (Netezza), MS SQL Server and HBase. Experience with data integration tools: Informatica, MS Integration Services, Sqoop, etc. Exposure to cloud vendors and services: AWS, Google, Microsoft, IBM Exposure to stream-processing systems: IBM Streams, Flume, Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc. Experience consuming and building APIs Experience with object-oriented/object function programming languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. Experience with statistical data analysis tools: R, SAS, SPSS, etc. Experience with visual analytics tools: QlikView, Tableau, Power BI etc. Familiarity to Agile methodology for development Familiarity with electronic health record and financial systems. i.e. Epic Systems, Cerner, WorkDay, Infor, Strata etc. All CHOP employees who work in a patient building or who provide patient care are required to receive an annual influenza vaccine unless they are granted a medical or religious exemption. Children's Hospital of Philadelphia is committed to providing a safe and healthy environment for its patients, family members, visitors and employees. In an effort to achieve this goal, employment at Children's Hospital of Philadelphia, other than for positions with regularly scheduled hours in New Jersey, is contingent upon an attestation that the job applicant does not use tobacco products. Children's Hospital of Philadelphia is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, national or ethnic origin, disability or protected veteran status. VEVRAA Federal Contractor/Seeking priority referrals for protected veterans.  Please contact our hiring official with any referrals or questions. Title: Senior Product Designer
Text: Want to do good in the world with your design superpowers? Every.org is a tech nonprofit with the mission to connect givers and nonprofits through a joyful donation experience. We want to make it easier for people to support their favorite causes and share their values. We believe that's the best way to foster the communal wisdom that can transform the nonprofit space. Read more here. We're a small team of driven people with backgrounds in mobile, product, web, data, and machine learning. We are eager to bring impactful product ideas to life. Previously we were at Snapchat, Pinterest, Nuna, Clever, MetaLab, AngelList, and Stanford. Who we're looking for A highly independent, experienced Product Designer to help us create digital experiences that are joyful, social, and human. This means: Desire to do good in the world and improve philanthropy Use of user research and metrics to make informed design decisions 4+ years experience making product and UX designs for digital products (please share examples!) Ability to quickly create wireframes and identify best product testing opportunities Clear communication skills to understand user needs and advocate for them Thrives in ambiguity and fast-paced startup environment Ability to collect, filter, and incorporate user feedback Empathetic communication and teamwork Preferred qualities 6+ years of professional design experience Experience working with engineers Experience building a design system Expertise in Figma Responsibilities You\u2019ll come up with product features to achieve impact goals (like raising more money for nonprofits!) You'll update and refine designs for our website and future apps alongside our visual designer You'll help refine the product, user experience, design system, while advocating for best practices in design You'll continuously collect feedback and iterate on designs to improve them Our Benefits Compensation range: $100,000-$170,000 USD, dependent on experience/location Flexible time off\u2014 we mean it! Fully remote Work laptop 4-month Paid Parental Leave (incl. birth, adoption, surrogacy for moms and dads) Comprehensive benefits including dental, medical, vision, 401(k) available to US employees Equipment and education allowance If this sounds like you, we would love to chat! Every.org is an Equal Opportunity Employer that embraces diversity. We believe diversity strengthens the team and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Title: Project Engineer
Text: As a Project Engineer, you will: Provide thought leadership, critical thinking & inquisitive mindset to lead global development teams through Technology development. Support internal / external customers and global cross-functional colleagues by communicating technical and project milestones & updates. Develop mastery of existing calculators and engineering tools as well as facilitation of creation of new design and analysis tools as needed/appropriate. Analyze & quantify value vs applied cost of compression technologies for system development. Apply high degree of independent engineering knowledge to lead cross functional efforts in technical development and problem solving. Conceive and execute development and testing plans based with a mindset towards risk mitigation, and coordinate with appropriate resources for timely execution. Apply and support the incorporation of Lean principles and techniques into the New Product Development process.  You make new connections and build relationships in other areas and teams. You keep in touch with internal and external customers. You encourage open dialogue to discuss alternative perspectives. You convert ideas into actions and produce results with new initiatives. You encourage healthy conflict and seek cooperative relationships. You drill down to root causes to gather relevant information. You manage uncertainty with confidence. Bachelor's Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent plus one (1) year of applicable experience (Co-op/Internship experience may be considered) Excellent presentation, written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills Proficient in the use of various computer programs such as Outlook, Word, Excel, and Powerpoint Ability to lead, manage, and prioritize multiple assignments Legal authorization to work in the United States unrestricted for an unlimited period of time - Sponsorship will not be provided for this role Two (2) years of relevant work experience in development of electrically driven rotating equipment or similar fields Experience with Minitab or other statistical software Experience working with and/or implementing lean techniques into the product development process Ability to communicate with technical, manufacturing, and business leaders at all levels Strong Thermodynamics, vapor compression cycle & heat transfer knowledge/experience applied to Air Conditioning & Heat Pump systems

Title: Quality Engineer
Text: Fluxergy is on the cutting edge of point-of-care diagnostics in both the human and veterinary spaces. You will aid us as part of the Quality team, to ensure our processes, procedures, and product meet ISO 13485 and FDA requirements. With this being an mid-level position, you will be expected to learn these processes quickly. However, our processes are always improving. So, quick and enthusiastic learners are desired. At Fluxergy, all employees are expected to improve the quality of our product. Because of this, you will have an active role with the Production Team to implement process improvements.Responsibilities Developing and implementing quality standards. and processes Developing and implementing quality control systems. Monitoring and analyzing quality performance. Inspecting and testing materials, equipment, processes, and products to ensure quality specifications are met. Collaborating with operations managers to develop and implement controls and improvements. Ensuring that workflows, processes, and products comply with safety and regulatory regulations. Investigating and troubleshooting product or production issues. Developing corrective actions, solutions, and improvements. Reviewing codes, specifications, and processes. Ensure documents progress through the proper approvals. Creates, manages and maintains document reports Update existing documents, edits new and revised documents, creates or edits flow charts and finalizes document formatting Review and audit Batch History Records and test sheets for completeness, accuracy & compliance to GMP Perform other duties as assigned to support business needs Requirements 3+ years of experience in quality engineering, quality assurance, or a similar role. 2+ years working with medical device industry with ISO 13485 Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Able to work efficiently in a team environment Experience coding and using QA software tools and processes. Excellent project management skills. Job Type Full Time Exempt Experience 3+ years of experience in quality engineering, quality assurance, or a similar role. 2+ years in a manufacturing environment 2+ years in medical device industry Experience with ISO 13485 and FDA is a plus Education Degree in quality, industrial, or mechanical engineering ASQ certification preferred. Benefits Offered Paid Time Off Parental leave Health insurance Dental insurance Retirement benefits or accounts Note: No agencies. All candidates/resumes submitted by an agency or 3rd party will be considered a referral. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $1.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee discount Flexible schedule Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations:Face masks are required. We provide sanitation stations at each main point of entry which includes disposable face masks, disposable gloves, tissues, and hand sanitizer. Experience: Quality Engineer: 3 years (Required) Application Question: How would you rate your computer (specifically Microsoft Office) skills from 1-10? 10 being expert What experience have you had in medical device industry?Have you had experience in obtaining or maintaining ISO 13485?Have you ever participate in a FDA inspection?Have you ever had to host an audit by yourself?Do you have any experience in auditing? What type of audits have you conducted?How do you manage resistance to the quality implementation?Can you tell me about a time when you worked in a highly stressed environment? What made is stressful?Have you ever had to documenting and executing a process or procedures in your previous place of employment?

Title: Industrial Engineer
Text: Job Title:  Industrial Engineering Shift: M-F (~50 hours) Location:  Phoenix, AZ Job Type:  Contract (6-12 months) Pay Rate:  $35-$45 / hr. (Based on Experience) Summary:  We are a company looking to create a brand-new trailer manufacturing facility. For this exciting opportunity, we are seeking a creative and experienced individual to assist with the development of our new facility.  Description:  To assist production by providing technical support. Lower the cost of production by eliminating wastes in both manpower and materials. Plans utilization of facilities, equipment, materials, and personnel to improve efficiency of operations by performing the following duties. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Studies functional statements, organization charts, and project information to determine functions and responsibilities of workers and work units and to identify areas of duplication. Establishes work measurement programs and analyzes work samples to develop standards for labor utilization. Analyzes work force utilization, facility layout, and operational data such as production costs, process flow charts, and production schedules, to determine efficient utilization of workers and equipment. Recommends methods for improving worker efficiency and reducing waste of materials and utilities such as restructuring job duties, reorganizing workflow, relocating workstations and equipment, and purchase of equipment. Confers with management and engineering staff to implement plans and recommendations. Coordinate and manage Engineering Changes (EC’s) Support weekly Engineering Change Control (ECC) meetings Support the ECR (Engineering Change Request) and approval process Develops management systems for cost analysis, financial planning, wage and salary administration, and job evaluation. Coordinate with Purchasing department to ensure that schedules prepared by suppliers support the overall program milestones. Interact with the customer as needed, to communicate timing for trials, and implementation plans Experience:  Industrial Engineering: 3 years (Required) Program/Project Management: 3 years (Preferred) Manufacturing: 4 years (Required) Job Types: Full-time, Contract Pay: $35.00 - $45.00 per hour Schedule: 10 hour shift 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Experience: Industrial Engineering: 3 years (Required) Program/Project Management: 3 years (Preferred) Manufacturing: 4 years (Required) Location: Phoenix, AZ 85009 (Required) Application Question: Please provide a personal email address. This Company Describes Its Culture as: Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focused Innovative -- innovative and risk-taking Aggressive -- competitive and growth-oriented Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture Stable -- traditional, stable, strong processes Team-oriented -- cooperative and collaborative Work Remotely: No

Title: Associate Field Engineer
Text: Analyze and solve engineering problems associated with field installation and operation of control systems and/or control equipment. Assist in carrying out more complex engineering assignments under the direction of a more senior field engineer Provide instruction to customer personnel as needed for those tasks usually assigned within this position's responsibilities Develop and maintain good customer relations on assigned tasks with emphasis on total customer satisfaction Participate in the writing, review and revision of field related and/or operational procedures associated with Company products Participate in team assignments aimed at problem resolution, project/product familiarization and product testing and evaluation You establish and maintain effective customer relationships. You prepare content for communication that is impactful. You readily action new challenges, without unnecessary planning. Bachelors degree in Engineering EE/EET or ME/MET 0-2 years of previous applicable experience Basic understanding of loading software on Window based computers Good troubleshooting skills when it comes to electrical wiring Requires up to 80% travel Legal authorization to work in the United States

Title: Electrical Engineer, Entry Level
Text: Performs basic power engineering tasks and calculations for water and wastewater treatment facilities under the direction and supervision of a Staff Electrical Engineer Receptacle designs, including panel schedule load and phase balancing Lighting designs, including zonal cavity calculations, luminaire layout, and circuit switching Conduit layout and fill calculations Wire sizing Performs basic CADD drafting Submittal review Performs specification research Assists in development of technical memorandum Reviews work for discrepancies or inconsistencies Tracks details of work to discuss and resolve Follows selected design approach through completion of analysis and detailing Logically organizes work Develops and improves technical knowledge and skills Maintains professionalism in relationships with other office and team members Plans what needs to be communicated and how to presents the information effectively Seeks out company and client technical standards and implements them on projects Constructively builds and maintains relationships with others on the project design team Travel required when requested Makes site visits to observe during construction and operation Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering Course work in power engineering Engineer-in-Training Certification or FE license; or ability to obtain within 1 year 0-4 years experience Basic and advanced course work in A.C. machinery, electrical measurements, symmetrical components, and control system logic design, design of computer LANs, industrial control system LANs and control system logic and design Basic understanding of the National Electrical Code Ability to read and understand One-Line Diagrams and Control Schematics Working knowledge of symmetrical components, fault current calculations, and machine theory Capable of breaking a task into one or more component parts and sequencing those parts effectively General awareness of need for practicality and constructability of design solutions General awareness of the scope, schedule and budget assigned for engineering tasks Ability to work with more experienced electrical engineers to apply standard textbook electrical design and analysis approach Ability to listen to others and ask clarifying questions at appropriate time Willingness to accept suggestions and corrections on organization and planning issues Seeks help to understand and productively work through conflict to keep tasks moving ahead Understanding that personal performance and actions impact future work opportunities General awareness of the "business" of electrical engineering as well as the technical design issues Strong verbal and written communications skills that are well organized and persuasive Proficient in MS Word and Excel Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering - Power Specialty Public speaking experience Experience with Microstation or Autocad Field investigative and start-up experience

Title: Noise & Vibration Simulation Engineer
Text: Summary You will excel in the role of N&V Simulation Engineer if you have a strong background in structural dynamics and/or acoustics, with 5+ years of experience in the noise/vibration field Extensive experience with simulation software packages, such as ANSYS, ABAQUS, Virtual-Lab, COMSOL, Maxwell… Experience in coupled structural/electro-magnetics/acoustics simulation Experience in dealing with non-linear systems, including material and geometry non-linearity Experience in product noise & vibration root cause identification Some experience in statistical energy analysis method Some experience in developing tools enhancing post-processing of simulation or experimental results A lover of learning new tools and software packages when needed A creative problem-solver who thrives in a fast-paced multi-tasking environment While not required, it is especially helpful if you have expertise in electro-magnetics, either experimental or simulation

Title: Mechanical Design Engineer - Chassis
Text: The Chassis Design Engineering team is responsible for tires, wheels, hubs, halfshafts, steering, suspension, subframes, brakes, pedals/controls, and air suspension systems on all of Tesla’s passenger car and heavy vehicle programs. A Mechanical Design Engineer on the team is responsible for bringing those systems from concept to production and beyond with support from other engineering teams at Tesla. The engineer’s responsibilities include design, analysis, sourcing, prototyping, testing, vehicle assembly validation, quality control, engineering documentation, and more. The engineer should be able to readily apply mechanical engineering fundamentals to creatively solve problems and learn quickly while managing their projects independently. We are looking for someone who will go beyond the status quo to make the best product in terms of cost, mass, and performance. The engineer should be able to communicate clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical colleagues. Hands-on experience is a major plus for engineering development work and addressing production issues. Some travel to suppliers may be required, including international travel.  Develop and optimize designs in 3D CAD software with associated CAE tools  Validate manufacturing, assembly, and service feasibility  Complete and release component designs and documentation, including 2D drawings  Validate components per defined engineering requirements  Resolve issues and concerns with cross-functional teams including engineering, supply chain, production, and service  Participate in the sourcing process and manage engineering relationships with suppliers  Deliver to defined schedules  Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent  Proficiency in a 3D CAD software (CATIA is a plus)  Basic knowledge of GD&T (proficiency is a plus) Experience with component design, analysis, and validation  Great technical and interpersonal communication  Evidence of being a self-starter and bringing projects to completion  Prior experience in a relevant engineering field is valued, but the team has openings from entry level to expert Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program

Title: Noise & Vibration Engineer - (Fans)
Text: Summary You have considerable knowledge of acoustic fundamentals, with 5+ years of experience in the noise/vibration field. You are familiar with fan noise sources and characterization techniques, or have experience in general aeroacoustics. You have acoustic and (optionally) vibration measurement skills, are fluent in data analysis methodology, and have experience making measurements in anechoic/hemi-anechoic chambers. Critical listener with excellent hearing over the audible frequency range. Creative problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced multi-tasking environment. You should have a passion for digging into the details to deliver products with the best user experience possible. A few useful skills, but not required… You have experience with JMP, MATLAB, ArtemiS, or similar programs. You have experience in the design, execution, and analysis of user studies. You have experience using precision-grade instrumentation for ultra low-noise measurements. You have a history of developing high-volume consumer electronics products.

Title: iPhone Acoustic Integration Engineer
