Apply final labels or markings as required to demonstrate product acceptance. Document and communicate any non-conformances identified during inspection activities. Perform calibration audits and support internal calibration activities Complete daily reports of inspection activities. Visual acuity and manual dexterity required. Ability to sit, stand, walk, bend, and lift up to 50 lbs. Full-time ***Only Available for the SANMINA-NEWARK location*** Job Purpose: Work includes assignment planning, layout, set up, operating and making tool adjustments for various types of manual, numerically controlled and computerized machine shop equipment. Works from blueprints, process sheets and sketches to perform production tasks, which may include the cutting and shaping of metal to precision dimensions. Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Work includes, set up, and operate CNC Horizontal Niigata mills. Using Fanuc 15 and 16I control. Works from blueprints and set up process sheets to perform production and prototype tasks. Full-time ***Only Available for the SANMINA-NEWARK location*** Job Purpose: Operates equipment used to manufacture products. Weighs, measures and checks raw materials to ensure that batches manufactured contain proper ingredients in proper quantities. Maintains inventory records of raw materials used in batch manufacturing Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Deburr / polish machined parts per drawing specifications. Install hardware to include dowel pins, heli-coil, pem nuts, and twin-cert. Must work with aluminum, stainless steel, mild steels, and plastics Must be able to use following tools: De-burr knife, de-burr whip, file, sand paper, scotch brite. Power tools to include orbital sander, belt sander, drill press, arbor press, polishing wheel. Full-time ***Only Available for the SANMINA-NEWARK location*** Facilities Maintenance Technician helps oversee the day-to-day operations of the building /facility. Nature of Duties: Handle building/building repairs Help conduct and maintain building inventories Move and put together furniture, handle cleaning, painting and stocking of employee areas. Works with both inside and outside clean up, maintenance operating site equipment and hand/power tools as needed. Assist Front Desk Admin with various tasks, update status of work with them to close out work request. Transport supplies and off-site storage. Open/Close daily work orders routed from work order system. Communicate/Coordinate with end users on work order tasks. Assist with equipment/instrument moves as directed. Assist employees with office moves. Assist with general ongoing building maintenance (including, but not limited to light bulb replacement, wall patching/painting, lab bench modifications, sign hanging, shelving and rack building). Perform corrective actions per EHS observations. Perform monthly emergency shower testing, fire extinguisher monitoring, and AED monitoring. Escort and oversee onsite facility related vendors. Ensure vendors and contractors are acting in accordance with guidelines. Setup / take down company events, moving chairs and tables. Full-time ***Only Available for the SANMINA-NEWARK location*** Job Purpose: Sanmina is looking for detail oriented and dedicated Quality Inspector for our Fremont, CA location.  In this role, you will be responsible for determining product acceptance both in-process and at final assembly by inspecting parts per customer drawings and workmanship standards.  You will make use of monitoring and measurement devices, as well as perform visual inspection.  You will document and submit the results of inspection and testing activities in both paper and electronic systems.  You will determine and may assist in developing methods and procedures for quality inspection and control.   Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Perform inspections to determine the quality of both metal components and electromechanical assemblies, visually and dimensionally, based upon internal and customer supplied workmanship standards and drawing specifications. Areas of inspection will include primarily clean room and final assembly inspection, but may extend to machining, sheet metal fabrication, paint and weld. Perform receiving inspection on incoming purchased components and raw materials. Determine and assist in developing methods and procedures for quality inspection and control. Apply final labels or markings as required to demonstrate product acceptance. Document and communicate any non-conformances identified during inspection activities. Perform calibration audits and support internal calibration activities Complete daily reports of inspection activities. Visual acuity and manual dexterity required. Ability to sit, stand, walk, bend and lift up to 50 lbs. Full-time ***Only Available for the SANMINA-NEWARK location*** Job Purpose The Quality Engineer will be responsible for the daily overview of production and new product introduction activities. The Quality Engineer with interface with the customer on quality issues. Additional responsibilities to include: Nature of Duties/Responsibilities Utilize quality tools and disciplines in response to customer quality concerns and internal quality improvement plans.  Lead problem solving teams for internal and external quality issues.  Interface with customers on critical issues or as needed. Additional responsibilities to include: Generating reports, improving Quality performance, and customer satisfaction through process improvement techniques such as SPC, FMEA, DOE, Lean manufacturing etc. Developing, applying, revising and maintaining quality standards for processing materials into partially finished or finished products. Develop work instructions for inspection/testing for QC personnel Design and implement methods and procedures for inspecting, testing and evaluating the precision and accuracy Analyze and verify effectiveness of process controls. Review and update Quality SOP and check list. Lead, coach and follow-up on problem solving activities and development of corrective actions.   Perform RCCA and CLCA and recommends corrective action for customer quality concerns and complaints. Support RMA/MRB material disposition. Establishes statistical confidence / determining levels of confidence.  Develop inspection check fixtures. Conduct internal/external audit and supplier audits. Manage particle count for cleaning room. Maintain and Improve suppler metrics, specifically QPPM and OTD targets Quality Control (QC) procedures and quality tools such as Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA), and Design of Experiments (DOE) Able to drive effective meetings and a team through problem resolution and have solid processes and solutions in place On hands type of person, mechanical engineering, special process engineering. Sanmina Corporation, 8455 Cabot Court, Plant #1357, Newark, CA 94560 US Fremont - Sanmina, 42735 Christy St, Plant #1393, Fremont, CA 94538 US Must be a permanent resident       The interview will take place on Indeed's virtual interviewing platform. After RSVP, you will find a link in your email that will lead you directly to the virtual interview lobby during the event. Try to find a quiet place with good lighting and a stable internet connection.                         Completing our online application prior to the event is strongly encouraged and will speed up the process.         Dress code is Business casual (dress pants/skirt, button down/blouse, optional tie).     Sanmina Corporation (Nasdaq: SANM) is a leading integrated manufacturing solutions provider serving the fastest-growing segments of the global Electronics Manufacturing Services (EMS) market. Recognized as a technology leader, Sanmina Corporation provides end-to-end manufacturing solutions, delivering superior quality and support to Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) primarily in the communications networks, defense and aerospace, industrial and semiconductor systems, medical, multimedia, computing and storage, automotive and clean technology sectors. Sanmina Corporation has facilities strategically located in key regions throughout the world.   Virtual hiring events are a great way for employers and jobseekers to connect, even if they aren't in the same physical location. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to talk with you online (either through chat, on the phone, or video) to see if you’re a fit! Full-time Job Purpose: As a CNC Lathe Machinist will set-up and run repeat or proven part(s) with simple to high complexity with minimal direction from area Lead or Supervisor. Responsible for utilizing shop paper procedures including updates, signatures and stamps, counting quantities, labeling, and non-conformance related activities. Read blueprints, tooling instructions, and standard charts for specifications Set-up, and run all facets of work assigned Provide technical assistance, guidance, and instruction to operators and lower level machinists as required. Ensure an accurate router accompanies all work orders Responsible for DNC communications upload and download tool programs Inspect and measure parts to maintain statistical process controls charts Assist Lead person as needed Start and observe machine operation to detect malfunctions or out-of-tolerance machining, and adjust machine controls as needed. Alert Lead or Supervisor to any issue(s) on job or machine. Able to recognize machine deviation versus cutter or work holding problems and alerts lead or supervisor. The candidate may also work closely with the Engineering and Assembly teams to provide in-process trouble-shooting and evaluate the quality of the machined components or finished product. Full-time Job Purpose: Develops, implements and maintains methods, operation sequence and processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, components, sub-assemblies and final assemblies.  Interfaces with design engineering in coordinating the release of new products. Estimates manufacturing cost, determines time standards and makes recommendations for tooling and process requirements of new or existing product lines. Maintains records and reporting systems for coordination of manufacturing operations. Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Monitoring and assessing process performance and enhancements through continuous improvement initiatives using “First Time Build” process design execution and reporting.  Reviewing Mechanical drawings and recommend DFM on Sheet metal, Frame, Integration Understanding and experience with  ERP system and Agile Full-time We are currently seeking a Master Production Scheduler to plan and prepare production schedules for the manufacture of industrial or commercial products to meet customer delivery requirements. This individual will establish and monitor inventory levels against forecasts while coordinating with Materials & Scheduling Manager, Sales, Engineering and Production Managers.    Nature of Duties/Responsibilities:  Creates master production schedule based on forecast and customer orders that will ensure complete and on time delivery. Creates production plans for multiple manufacturing/assembly sites. Maintains the master production schedule for the facilities, reviewing daily to adjust for changes in customer requirements, delay in receiving raw materials, availability of production equipment and manpower. Advises appropriate parties in the plants of the changes in the schedule. Reviews monthly sales forecasts and adjusts master schedules accordingly. Review inventory stocking levels and system forecasts that support both customer demand as well as inventory targets set by the company. Full-time The Sr. Mechanical Design Engineer is responsible for mechanical design and development of electro-mechanical products. The scope of responsibilities include complete product development cycle from concept to prototype (NPI) and release to production.  In addition, responsibilities may include Design for Manufacturing (DFM) and Value Engineering support for existing products designed by customers and manufactured by Sanmina.  He/she will work on a range of products in industrial, semiconductor, renewable energy, telecom, networking, high-end computing and storage servers, medical, and multimedia markets. The successful candidate shall be self motivated, proactive, and have good communication skills. Strong customer communication and interaction skills is a must   Full-time Job Purpose: Plans, schedules, coordinates and/or monitors final approval of products through the complete production cycle. Works from engineering plans and production specifications to establish production schedules, labor loading, and capacity requirements. Coordinates production plans to ensure materials are provided according to schedules. Master Scheduler: Provides input to management; schedules and/or interfaces with marketing, sales, production and engineering managers. Works to resolve (in case of design changes) labor and material shortages, backlogs and other potential schedule interruptions. Oversees the master schedules and ensures comprehensive compliance with materials requirements for manufacturing. Analyze customer demand and optimize build plans for specific products, keeping materials and resource requirements.  Review New products/parts planning attributes and ensure they are correctly set up.  Review BOM structures and ensure that they align with manufacturing strategy.  Periodically review critical ERP planning attributes and keep them aligned. Full-time Job Purpose: Maintains work areas of offices and industrial buildings to keep them clean and orderly. Uses janitorial supplies, maintains machining areas and removes waste material. Performs special cleaning projects as assigned. Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Performs both light and heavy janitorial duties in industrial settings, such as manufacturing facilities, warehouses and processing plants. Works responsibilities under hazardous conditions, sometimes requiring the use of specialized machinery and safety equipment. Maintains a clean and safe environment for the day-to-day operations of the facility.      Cleans, sweeps, mops, scrubs, waxes, and polishes floors by hand or machine; cleans carpet, upholstery and furniture. Operates high-pressure power washing equipment and powered industrial trucks using upon the workplace, an industrial cleaner may also remove hazardous chemicals or be required to clean, inspect, maintain and repair equipment and machinery. Washes windows, screens, sills, woodwork, doors, desks, walls, and ceilings. Orders and stocks needed materials and supplies. Moves certain equipment and furniture if applicable.   Full-time Job Purpose: Sanmina is looking for a Program Manager to join our Operations in Fremont, CA.  The candidate must have experience in program management, negotiating pricing, managing customer relationships, and managing operational costs in an Electronics and/or Systems manufacturing environment. Nature of Duties: Manage the development and implementation process of the customer’s products and services involving departmental teams focused on the delivery of new or existing products. Serves as liaison between the company and the customer throughout the business relationship. Ensures customer satisfaction by managing the details of overall project schedules, budgets, deliverables and performance. Visit customer’s sites as needed to develop relationships and manage programs. Research accounts daily to inform customer on the status of their product.  Be prepared for questions that the customer may have and supply them with every option available. Manage the processes of loading incoming customer orders, payment invoicing, and revenue recognition. Plan and direct schedules/forecasts.  Maintain accurate backlog by customer or product. Full-time Job Purpose: Performs functions associated with quality control and quality assurance operations, including working with engineers in set-up and calibration tasks and carrying out rework and quality assurance procedures related to production or operations. Uses sophisticated programs to collect and evaluate data to assist in assessing and documenting results of quality assurance and control processes. Determines and may assist in developing methods and procedures for quality assurance and control. Works with engineers in conducting experiments. Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Perform electro and mechanical assembly inspections based upon internal and customer supplied workmanship standards and specifications. Areas of inspection will include machining, sheet metal fabrication, weld (receiving, clean room, paint and final inspection). Develops and managing tools and gauge calibration program with ability to perform gauge calibration, preventative maintenance, gauge repeatability and reliability studies and gauge layout. Full-time As the Fremont plant Sr. Quality Manager, you will be responsible for developing a world class quality department and driving plant wide continuous improvement that results in unparalleled quality performance. You will have the opportunity to reinforce foundational quality principals, as we develop innovative manufacturing and inspection processes at the leading edge of automation and machining technology. This position will be responsible for managing, coordinating and administering all functions of the site’s Quality Management System, including receiving inspection activities, quality engineering, supplier quality management and the QC laboratory.  Nature of Duties/Responsibilities: Lead and mentor QA Department, consisting of quality engineers, receiving inspection, and QC personnel Be an outspoken advocate for Quality First throughout the plant Expediently and effectively communicate with customers on quality escapes, visits, escalations, etc. Maintain and improve the site QMS (including NCR and CAPA system, internal audit, training, etc.) Full-time Job Purpose: Sanmina is looking for a detail-oriented and dedicated Quality Inspector for our Newark, CA location.  In this role, you will be responsible for determining product acceptance both in-process and at the final assembly by inspecting parts per customer drawings and workmanship standards.  You will make use of monitoring and measurement devices, as well as perform a visual inspection.  You will document and submit the results of inspection and testing activities in both paper and electronic systems.  You will determine and may assist in developing methods and procedures for quality inspection and control. Title: R&D Mechanical Engineer - Hercules, CA Virtual Hiring Event
Text: Interviews on the spot 11:00 AM - 3:00 PM US/Pacific You'll receive an email on how to connect. Full-time The Clinical Immunology group is looking for a Staff Scientist with extensive experience in the development and troubleshooting of in-vitro diagnostics products for its BioPlex 2200 multiplex platform. The individual will execute cross-functional projects to support new products for transfer into manufacturing and introduce improvements in material sourcing and manufacturing processes. The BioPlex 2200 System is a fully automated, random access multiplex testing platform that combines automation with the diagnostic power of proprietary multiplex chemistry and state-of-the-art eFlex software to bring a new level of flexibility and operational benefits to the laboratory. Job Qualifications: PhD in a biological or physical science. Minimum of 6 years of postdoctoral industrial experience.  Direct experience with immunoassay development, particularly with multiplex technologies.  Strong instrumentation background, preferably with automated immunoassay platforms.  Experience in the in-vitro diagnostics industry preferred.  Strong track record of in the development and commercialization of new products. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Demonstrated track record of technical leadership of complex projects and in transferring new products   to a manufacturing environment. Fluent in protein chemistry techniques including purification, modification, and characterization.  Fluent in immunoassay and immunochemistry techniques including traditional and recombinant antibody development, screening and characterization.  Fluent in the use of molecular biology techniques including cloning and protein expression Experience with multiplex technologies including bead-based assay development preferred. Laboratory automation experience required. Strong computer and data analysis skills, including the use of statistical and bioinformatics techniques and designed experiments (DOE) required. Full-time Supervise the quality control team and manage quality control functions, including inspection testing for raw materials. Chromatography resins, buffers, dyes and raw materials produced or used at the Bio-Rad chemical production plant. Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a related field, preferably chemistry.  6+ years quality control or manufacturing experience. 3-5 years of supervisory experience. Strong technical and analytical skills required. Strong communication, public-speaking, decision-making, MS Office, and negotiation skills. Background in statistical analysis and process capability studies-a plus.  Familiarity with SAP or similar ERP systems a plus. Understanding of  ISO 13485, FDA regulations, GMP and GLP required. Excellent time management skills and ability to work both independently and in a team environment. Direct supervisory experience of exempt or non-exempt employees. Strong customer orientation and focus. Full-time Bio-Rad is seeking a senior technical communicator. The senior software technical communicator researches and documents hardware and software products and produces industry standard documentation in a single-source, automated delivery publication process according to established templates and standards. Job Qualifications: B.A. or B.S. degree is required. A degree in English, Journalism, Life sciences, Chemistry, Biology or similar field. At least 5 years as a senior software technical communicator with proven ability to produce first edition software manuals and online help systems. Proven stable work experience with increasing responsibilities in the role of senior software technical. Clear, concise technical writing, on-line and hands-on research, interviewing and listening skills, ability to learn new tools, applications, and technologies quickly. Strong attention to detail, solid project management skills for own projects, ability to work on multiple projects and to deliver quality documentation on time. Strong knowledge of single sourcing documentation topics and images in multiple output is required; current knowledge of MadCap Flare is required. Ability to work independently with moderate supervision is required. Knowledge of GitHub and Perforce or another source control system. Knowledge of Agile development and ability to work productively in Scrum teams. Self-motivated. Full-time Bio-Rad has an open position for a Senior Scientist in our chromatography media chemistry group. The Senior Scientist role will support our efforts in the design, evaluation, manufacture transfer, and applications of new chromatographic resins and membranes for the separation of biomolecules. Job Qualifications: PhD in biochemistry/protein Chemistry/molecular biology/ cell biology (or related field), with 0 ~ 3 years of work/research experience; prior experience in the purification/preparation/infectivity assays of viruses/VLPs from cell culture is a significant plus. Broad knowledge in protein or other biological molecules separation and characterization. Demonstrated proficiency in problem-solving, data analysis and basic troubleshooting of experimental problems. Strong interpersonal skills, oral presentation and technical writing skills; proven publication record. Business travel (occasional and minimal) as needed. Experience in the purification of biological molecules (proteins, nucleic acids, viruses/VLPs) using chromatography and membrane filtration methods; experience in the expression and purification of monoclonal antibodies, recombinant proteins, and viruses/VLP from mammalian/bacterial expression systems is a plus. Experience in protein/nucleic purity and quantity analysis (SDS-PAGE, HPLC, UV-vis, ELISA) and protein activity assays; DNA sequence analysis/alignment. Working knowledge of basic tools for random or site-directed mutagenesis. Ability to work in a multi-disciplinary team, as an independent researcher; ability to provide technical guidance to junior team members. Publications on peer reviewed journals and presentations at conferences. Full-time Bio-Rad is seeking a Product Manager. The new Product Manager will lead the commercialization of assays and instruments for immunoassays and protein characterization, drive long-term strategies and near term tactics to increase product line sales, and identify new product opportunities and product improvements.  This Product Manager, in collaboration with the product development marketing team,  will be responsible for downstream product commercialization, working closely with the collaborations team to foster KOL communities, develop and warm the market for new products, and ensure the long-term commercial success of the product portfolio. In addition, the Product Manager will be in charge of developing and leading effective marketing campaigns and working with regional counterparts to support regional tactics with the end goals of upholding product value propositions and positioning, driving product adoption and attachment rates, and growing product revenues. Job Qualifications: B.S. in Biology, Biochemistry, Immunology or similar, immunoassay experience a plus M.B.A. or M.S., Preferred. 7+ Years of product commercialization and downstream marketing, instrumentation experience required. Customer-centric view of commercialization and marketing techniques. Excellent Communication Skills, both written and verbal. High level of comfort in public speaking, both in a large group and small group settings. Energetic, people-person who is curious about customer motivation, behaviors, and trends. Full-time   Bio-Rad is looking for an experienced Mechanical Engineer who gets excited about product development, is highly analytical, and sees the big picture needed to evolve a concept into a product. You will be a part of the R&D Engineering Team, a multi-disciplinary team developing instrument system solutions for Bio-Rad’s Life Sciences portfolio, including biomedical imaging, PCR, microscopy, chromatography, and cell sorting instrument platforms. Job Qualifications: Work with scientists, engineers, project managers, and marketing staff to develop product requirements, specifications, qualification tests, and other project documentation. Perform risk analysis and use risk based decision making. Design parts and assemblies using Solidworks and other tools. Analyze and Verify designs. Transfer finished designs to Manufacturing. Work closely with Manufacturing Engineering and instrument production staff. Act as technical expert during product releases and sustaining activities. Prepare and make presentations, and create, present, or be active in design reviews. Perform root cause analysis and initiate corrective/preventive actions. Full-time Bio-Rad is looking for an enthusiastic Qt applications engineer excited about working with embedded linux to join our software development team! Job Qualifications: Work within a cross-functional team to plan, create, and maintain scientific applications Design, develop, test, and release new functionality focusing on customer experience Use best software development practices to create robust and maintainable software Continuously participate in improving the team development process by sharing your ideas while keeping an open mind and being receptive to feedback. BS or MS in Computer Science Passionate about writing clean, maintainable, well organized C++ code Comfortable working with embedded Linux Experience with the Linux Yocto build system Enjoy creating user interfaces using QML Full-time Bio-Rad Laboratories is looking for a seasoned and autonomous Supplier Quality Engineer to support the local and remote locations of Bio-Rad. You’ll have the opportunity to work with Bio-Rad’s suppliers to qualify, audit and maintain relationships that keep the supply chain moving. You’ll collaborate with various stakeholders, improve audit work instructions and generally implement continuous improvement in the Supplier Audit process in order to foster long-term supplier relationships. Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Engineering (Mechanical, Electrical or Chemical).   ASQ CQE, ASQ CQA, or ISO 13485 Lead Auditor Certification. 7+ years’ in an engineering, quality assurance and/or manufacturing supplier quality environment. Experience with Six Sigma and/or Lean Manufacturing. Advanced verbal and written communication skills in order to effectively communicate with internal customers and suppliers, and to develop and present communication plans and strategies.    Full-time Join the fast-growing Digital PCR center of Bio-Rad based in Pleasanton, CA. We are looking for an experienced Software Developer to join our team and help with the effort to build and extend existing software applicartions.  This individual will be working with a team to design and develop software platforms for biological discovery and medical diagnosis and treatment.  Job Qualifications: Proven record of strong technical leadership 12+ years experience developing enterprise class software applications At least 5 years’ experience in .NET, C#, WPF & XAML and the willingness to learn new technologies Solid understanding of object-oriented design and programming concepts Experience with test automation: TDD, unit/integration/functional testing Team player, able to work in a high pace environment with lots of ambiguity and short turn-around times. B.S. or equivalent degree in Computer Science Implementation experience following an Agile software development lifecycle approach Excellent verbal, written and graphical communication skills Passionate about delivering high-value applications Collaborative with a history of success in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary environment Full-time Join the fast-growing Digital PCR center of Bio-Rad based in Pleasanton, CA. We are looking for an experienced Software Developer to join our team and help with the effort to build and extend existing software applications. This individual will be working with a team to design and develop software platforms for biological discovery and medical diagnosis and treatment. Job Qualifications: 10+ years experience developing enterprise class software applications At least 5 years’ experience in .NET, C#, WPF & XAML and the willingness to learn new technologies Solid understanding of object-oriented design and programming concepts Experience with test automation: TDD, unit/integration/functional testing Team player, able to work in a high pace environment with lots of ambiguity and short turn-around times. B.S. or equivalent degree in Computer Science Implementation experience following an Agile software development lifecycle approach Excellent verbal, written and graphical communication skills Passionate about delivering high-value applications Collaborative with a history of success in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary environment Full-time We are looking for an enthusiastic full stack software engineer who wants to improve their technical skills and join a professional team that is building a new web application that will transform the way scientists use Bio-Rad products and make scientific discoveries. Our products are used by our customers to create new cancer therapeutics, gene therapies, and diabetes diagnostics and treatments. We offer a startup project and team culture, but in a stable company with good work life balance. We are building a new product from the ground up, using the latest technologies. You will be working with guidance from other team members, to create a cloud application that values security, scaling and agility and strives to use current best practices. Job Qualifications: BS in Engineering/Biophysics or Equivalent. MS/PhD Desirable. 8+ yrs Experience Developing Systems for Analytical and/or Diagnostics Applications. Working Knowledge of Statistics, DOE, DFSS, and Design for Excellence Desirable. Experience with QSR/ISO Regulations, Agency Testing, and Usability Engineering. Experience with Medical Device Development (IVD) Desirable. Full-time We are looking for an enthusiastic full stack software engineer who wants to improve their technical skills and join a professional team that is building a new web application that will transform the way scientists use Bio-Rad products and make scientific discoveries. Our products are used by our customers to create new cancer therapeutics, gene therapies, and diabetes diagnostics and treatments. We offer a startup project and team culture, but in a stable company with good work life balance. We are building a new product from the ground up, using the latest technologies. You will be working with guidance from other team members, to create a cloud application that values security, scaling and agility and strives to use current best practices. Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related technology discipline or equivalent experience. 3+ years of experience in web application development. Proficient knowledge of a back-end programming language including JavaScript and Python. Experience using Node.JS . Experience designing and implementing web APIs. Experience in Agile and DevOps environments and cultures. Proficient understanding of code versioning tools including Git. Understanding of the principles of automated testing platforms and unit tests. Basic familiarity with cloud security: data protection, identity and access management, public key infrastructure. Familiarity with modern cloud infrastructure capabilities (compute, storage, networking, containerization, microservices, lambda, NoSQL and SQL). Comfortable in Linux/Unix command line. Passionate about writing clean, maintainable, well organized code. Familiarity with CSS, HTML. Familiarity with React, Redux and Immutable. Boto3 experience. Experience working with a cloud platform as a service (PaaS) environment. Preferably AWS. Experience working on a customer-facing product. Familiarity with modern cloud infrastructure capabilities. Familiarity with cloud security best practices. Full-time Bio-Rad is seeking a Cyber Threat Security Intelligence Analyst. Bio-Rad is on a multi-year journey to transition our embedded products and traditional on-premise IT solutions to cloud-based services and platforms. As a part of Global IT’s mission to enable standardized, cost-effective technology solutions, we are seeking an experienced cyber threat intelligence analyst who will provide cyber threats/risks identification and mitigation/remediation to multiple IT teams to ensure a highly secure IT environment. Job Qualifications: Knowledge of cyber threat intelligence models (MITRE ATT&CK, Kill Chain, Diamond Model) Knowledge of network security architecture concepts, digital forensics, malware analysis concepts and methodology Experience working in incident response, cyber threat intelligence and or other IT related fields tied to networking and enterprise information system environments with Office 365, AWS, SAP, Documentation Management Systems, LIMS, Cloud-based B2B and B2C applications and related interfaces [Preferred] Experience with computer programming languages PHP, Python, SQL, C++, Perl, Java or Bash [Preferred] Working knowledge of relevant analytical tools such as WireShar, PassiveDNS, VirusTotal, and forensic tools (Encase, Access Data) – all preferred [Preferred] Experience with compliance standards such as SOC2, SOX, FDA, 21 CFR Par 11, GxP, HIPAA, GDPR, ISO 20001, PCI, CIS, Foundations Benchmark Full-time Bio-Rad is looking for a Staff Scientist with extensive experience in upstream bioprocess development and troubleshooting for the Reagents Manufacturing Process Development team. The individual will execute cross-functional projects related to development and continuous improvement for our product lines with a focus on Protein Chemistry and Molecular Biology Reagents, digital PCR reagents and the Bio-Plex suspension array system.The successful candidate will utilize his/her expertise in upstream bioprocess to support new products for transfer into manufacturing, to troubleshoot existing manufacturing processes, and to introduce improvements in material sourcing and manufacturing processes. Job Qualifications: Master's Degree and/or Doctorate Degree in Engineering field in bioprocessing or Scientific field in chemistry, biology or biochemistry. Minimum of 6+ years industry experience is highly desirable for this position. Extensive to expert level understanding of processes, equipment, and methods in 2-3 technical areas. Strong leadership skills in a technical area to influence process improvement & change. Able to apply scientific training to solve manufacturing and operational issues. Ability to build relationships through inter-organization collaboration and to translate technical information to all organization levels. The individual will execute cross-functional projects related to development and continuous improvement for our product lines with a focus on Protein Chemistry and Molecular Biology Reagents, digital PCR reagents and the Bio-Plex suspension array system.The successful candidate will utilize his/her expertise in analytical biochemistry to support new products for transfer into manufacturing, to identify root cause to materials and to introduce improvements in material sourcing and manufacturing processes.Job Qualifications: Master/Doctorate Degree in Analytical Chemistry, Biochemistry, Chemistry or related discipline. Minimum of 6+ years industry experience in analytical developments highly desirable for this position. Experience in protein biochemistry, biophysical, analytical characterization methods, and protein modification using chemical methods. Must have in-depth knowledge and hands-on experience in analytical method development (not limited to HPLC, CE, LC-MS, UV, FLD, BioAnalyzer, etc) and characterization for biologics. Extensive to expert level understanding of processes, equipment, and methods in 2-3 technical areas. Strong leadership skills in a technical area to influence process improvement & change. Full-time Bio-Rad is seeking a Manufacturing Scientist II. The successful candidate will provide product and process support for manufacturing, supply chain and quality control department. Identifying root causes of product failures and determining batch specific rework if necessary, revise Material Specs, Production and Quality Control Procedures as indicated by investigations. Perform raw material and finished product validation/qualification studies and generate reports summarizing work and recommendations. Complete and initiate Deviation and Non-conformance (QN) Reports. Perform instrument validation and maintenance as needed. Participate in the new product introduction and Scale up. Implement Management of Change work process to review and control changes required to drive improvement. Minimum of 5 years’ industry experience is required in related industry. Computer Aided Design (CAD) experience preferred; Design of experiments (DoE) methods preferred Mid-level understanding of statistical techniques. Title: Mechanical Engineer
Text: WhisperKOOL is hiring a Mechanical Engineer in our Stockton, CA office! We’re looking for a strong mechanical engineer to join our organization. We pride ourselves on offering innovative and well-crafted world class products. While acting as a mentor to our production and R & D teams, our mechanical engineer will engage in rigorous analytic and design processes using the most up-to-date computer software. Our ideal candidate will have experience with the entire production lifecycle, ushering mechanical solutions from research and design through implementation. The best qualified candidate is looking for: · a family-oriented company to call home · a highly innovative and creative environment They possess the following qualities: · Enjoys resolving challenging situations, projects, and obstacles · Possesses a passion for design and 3d modeling · Team player mentality – works well when collaborating with others · Problem solving mentality (optimistic) · Energetic attitude, works more than the minimum requirement · Positive attitude to contribute to a lively team culture Job Duties and Requirements · 3 -8 years of experience as a Mechanical Engineer · Solid works · Auto Cad · Precision Sheet Metal Design · Design from render (picture) to 3D modeling · Understanding of precision sheet metal equipment used in manufacturing · Can take a top view vision and create a working system · Refrigeration Experience and/or Understanding of Thermodynamics · Manufacturing · Design systems for ease of manufacturing · Process development and improvement (Lean Manufacturing) · Tooling and machinery experience · Collaborate with production to improve builds and current designs Additional Criteria for best qualified applicants:  · Understandings of UL – ETL and CE listings · Ability to interpret HVAC/R standards and documentation · Understanding of how components work and function · Compressor · Hermetic · Rotary · Vane · Scroll · lTXV’s and Solenoids · Parametric and Thermostat Controls · Humidity · Cooling Cycles · Heating Cycles · Heat Transfer (Coils) · Understanding of testing instrumentation and fundamentals · Understandings of Air Flow Measurements (CFM, Feet Per Minute ETC.) · Market Research for technologies used in HVAC/R Industry · Refrigeration component selection and sizing · Establish refrigeration system designs which meet energy efficiency standards Job Type: Full-time Pay: $65,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year Benefits: Dental insurance Disability insurance Health insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: mechanical engineer: 3 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work Remotely: No

Title: Chemical Engineer – Fluidics and Thermodynamics Focus
Text: Job Title Chemical Engineer – Fluidics and Thermodynamics Focus Classification Exempt:  Non-Exempt: (Hourly) Reports to:  Senior Director, Platform Development Job Description Summary/Objective We are seeking a qualified Chemical Engineer for our research and development team. This position will require a combined working knowledge of chemistry, thermodynamics, and fluidics to design, develop, and transfer to production automated instrument systems in a GMP-regulated environment. Duties will include prototype/test fixture design, testing and data collection, statistical analysis, while ensuring product designs comply with industry safety standards. Participation in ongoing education opportunities to maintain knowledge of emerging technologies, materials, and methods is expected. Essential Functions Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 1 Perform chemical analysis and physical property testing of materials and products. 2 Use knowledge of thermodynamics and fluidics to design new or evaluate existing automated instrument platforms. 3 Examine reasons for material or system failures and identify root cause of the problem. Suggest remedial measures and implement mitigation. 4 Design test fixtures, processes and prototypes as required. 5 Ensure compliance with applicable safety standards in design and development. 6 Be proactive and stay abreast of the latest materials and process technologies and industry trends; recommend and initiate new information, allowing for a competitive advantage in design. 7 Interact effectively with vendors and suppliers. 8 Devise testing methods to evaluate the effects of process, use conditions and chemical and material compatibility. 9 Contribute technical expertise to process design, development, implementation, and improvement 10 High level of organizational skills Competencies 1 Proficiency with SolidWorks Ver. 16 and later. 2 Proficiency in use of simulation and modeling software. 3 Working proficiency with Microsoft Office suite required. 4 Proven record of creative and effective problem-solving in design and development and manufacturing processes 5 Knowledge about polymer industry, products and technologies is necessary. 6 Highly motivated with a good ability to take direction but able to independently develop solutions. 7 Detail-oriented. 8 Ability to design from scratch and modify existing designs to improve overall performance, manufacturability, field serviceability, and cost effectiveness. 9 Tolerant of a highly dynamic environment that may require frequent re-designs and re-optimization of work. 10 Strong collaborative skills, both with other engineering disciplines and with scientific, regulatory, quality, and production teams 11 Strong written, verbal, and presentation skills. 12 Must be able to write clear, understandable documentation with effective presentation of information. 13 Basic understanding of GMP and its application to the job. Supervisory Responsibility This position requires no supervisory responsibility. Work Environment This job operates in a professional office, laboratory or shop environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as a desktop computers and smartphones. The worker is subject to environmental conditions. Protection from weather conditions but not necessarily from temperature changes. The worker is subject to hazards. Includes a variety of physical conditions, such as proximity to moving mechanical parts and exposure to chemicals. The worker is subject to atmospheric conditions. One or more of the following conditions that affect the respiratory system of the skin: fumes, odors, dust, mists, gases, or poor ventilation. Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stoop: Bending body downward and forward by bending spine at the waist. Kneel: Bending legs at knee to come to a rest on knee or knees. Crouch: Bending the body downward and forward by bending leg and spine. Crawl: Moving about on hands and knees or hands and feet. Reach: Extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction. Stand: Particularly for sustained periods of time. Walk: Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly for long distances or moving from one work site to another. Push: Using upper extremities to press against something with steady force in order to thrust forward, downward or outward. Pull: Using upper extremities to exert force in order to draw, haul or tug objects in a sustained motion. Lift: Raising objects from a lower to a higher position or moving objects horizontally from position-to-position. Fingering: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with the whole hand as in handling. Grasp: Applying pressure to an object with the fingers and palm. Feel: Perceiving attributes of objects, such as size, shape, temperature or texture by touching with skin, particularly that of fingertips. Talk: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word. Those activities in which they must convey detailed or important spoken instructions to other workers accurately, loudly, or quickly. Hear: Perceiving the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and to make the discriminations in sound. Repetitive motion: Substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Light work: Exerting up to 20 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 pounds of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects. The worker is required to have visual acuity to perform an activity such as: operates machines where the seeing job is at or within arm's reach; performs mechanical or skilled trades tasks of a non-repetitive nature. Position Type/Expected Hours of Work This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Monday – Friday. This position may require extended weekday or weekend hours depending on business needs. Travel Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-area and overnight travel may be expected. Less than 10% travel is required. Required Education and Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Chemical Engineering required with two to five (2-5) years’ experience, experience must include managing at least one (1) Commercial Development project from inception through completion. Work Authorization Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States. AAP/EEO Statement  Biocare Medical is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Other Duties Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $0.00 per month Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Referral program Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: Prototype/test fixture design, testing and data collection: 5 years (Preferred) Managing at least one (1) Commercial Development project: 2 years (Required) Chemical Engineering: 5 years (Required) Working knowledge of chemistry, thermodynamics & fluidics: 5 years (Preferred) GMP-regulated environment: 5 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Company's website: www.biocare.net Benefit Conditions: Waiting period may apply Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

Title: Process Engineer
Text: Process Engineer Clear Lake, IA $60-75k Our manufacturing company is searching for a Process Engineer in the Clear Lake, IA area. This Engineer will identify and deliver service improvement activity across the business through employing process improvement methodologies and the application of innovative thinking. Key Responsibilities: Work with key business stakeholders, and multi-jurisdictional LEAN champions, to build a continuous improvement environment to support an ongoing program of change. Lead and facilitate LEAN/process improvement-based workshops to drive ideas and solutions. Identify trends and process variations as part of establishing a continuous improvement monitoring system. Recommend methods for improving utilization of personnel, material and utilities. Recommend modifications to existing quality or production standards to achieve optimum quality within limits of equipment capability. Create and maintain products in ERP system, including materials, time, routing, coefficients and cost. Job Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering. 3+ years of experience with Continuous Improvement and helping to drive engineering principles and process improvement. Lean Manufacturing experience. Experience with Process Improvement Methodologies and innovative thinking. ERP experience. Experience with time studies and motion studies. Additional Incentives: Comprehensive Health Benefits Package 401k Vacation and Paid Time Off Process Engineer, utilization, methods, modifications, products, ERP, materials, time, routing, cost, LEAN, stakeholders, continuous improvement, improvement

Title: Manufacturing Engineer
Text: Maxar is currently seeking a Manufacturing Engineer to join out team in San Jose, CA location. As part of the machining and manufacturing team, you will work with a highly-skilled team of engineers/machinists to produce high-quality components for aerospace products.  Responsibilities Determine the sequence of operations necessary to fabricate or assemble complex parts, assemblies, and equipment. Develop related manufacturing instructions. Develop operation layouts and material handling systems. Determine equipment requirements and prepare related cost estimates. Participate in advanced studies, product design, and subsequent engineering changes for productivity issues. Analyze potential technical problems as related to production. Make recommendations concerning new developments or processes in production in order to improve processes and reduce cycle time, cost, and schedule. Formulate tooling concepts for tool design. Participate in statistical process control activities for quality and productivity improvements.  Minimum Requirements Must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident Bachelor's degree in Manufacturing Engineering, Industrial Technology, Industrial Management, or a related field. Four additional years of experience may be substituted for a degree Minimum of two years of manufacturing engineering or a related field, with a good knowledge of manufacturing systems, controls, processes, techniques, computer aided engineering and manufacturing technology  Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in a related field Experience using Systems, Applications, and Products in Data Processing (SAP) software and Creo 4.0 software Ability to excel in a team environment  Maxar Technologies values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Assistant Engineer
Text: FINAL FILING DATE: We are accepting applications until closing at 5 pm, September 21, 2020. IT IS MANDATORY THAT YOU COMPLETE THE SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE. YOUR APPLICATION WILL BE REJECTED IF YOU DO NOT PROVIDE ALL NECESSARY INFORMATION. THE POSITION The Human Resources Department is accepting applications for the regular and full-time position of Assistant Engineer in the Environmental Utilities Department. The list established for this recruitment may also be utilized to fill any regular full-time, limited term or part-time, temporary vacancies within the Environmental Utilities, Public Works and Development Services departments. The term length for limited term placements is not guaranteed but cannot exceed 36 months. A part-time temporary position cannot exceed 25 hours per week. The normal work schedule is Monday through Friday, 8 –5 pm; a flex schedule may be available. The City of Roseville promotes a no smoking atmosphere. THE CITY The City of Roseville (COR) incorporates the following CORe Competencies as part of the City’s culture: Focus on people: Develop and deliver service-oriented solutions that meet or exceed expectations. Build trust: Ensure honesty and integrity to gain confidence and support of others. Ensure accountability: Take responsibility for the outcomes of one’s own work and foster a sense of ownership in others. Communicate effectively: Deliver clear, concise messages and actively listen to ideas and questions. Collaborate inclusively: Build effective working partnerships, alliances, and teams. Make quality decisions: Make sound, timely decisions and recommendations. Be adaptable/agile: Change approach or methods to best fit the situation and effectively balance competing priorities. DEFINITION To perform professional engineering work in the investigation, planning, design, construction, and maintenance/operation of a variety of public works facilities, systems, projects and/or private development projects. DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS This is the entry level in the professional engineering series. This class is distinguished from the Junior Engineer by the performance of the more routine tasks and duties assigned to positions within this class. Employees at this level are not expected to perform with the same level of independence of direction and judgment on matters allocated to the Associate Engineer. Since this class is typically used as a training class, employees have only limited professional engineering work experience. Employees work under general supervision while learning job tasks. SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED Receives general supervision from higher level engineering staff. EXAMPLES OF ESSENTIAL DUTIES - Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following: Participate in or prepare plans and specifications for the design, construction, and maintenance/operation of a variety of public works facilities and projects, including water and wastewater utility, solid waste, street, storm drain, storm water management and traffic/transportation systems; ensure conformance to City standards and practices. Research project design requirements and perform routine calculations; conduct plan checks to ensure contractor and/or enforce compliance with City and various environmental regulatory standards; prepare time and material cost estimates, especially as related to existing or anticipated project budgets. May delegate routine research, design, and drafting tasks to technical staff; review completed work and assist in identifying solutions for solving routine problems; research publications and industry information sources as needed. Survey, map, and collect data related to area of assignment, as appropriate; perform field inspections, including survey work as necessary, to investigate and resolve routine field problems affecting property owners, contractors and maintenance operations; prepare estimates and feasibility reports for new or modified services and structures. Participate in or review and process private development plans as related to streets, storm drains, traffic/transportation, water/wastewater utilities, solid waste systems, and related public works facilities and systems; ensure that such plans comply with City standards and requirements. Participate in or prepare engineering studies and reports; participate in coordinating public works-related activities with other City departments, divisions, and sections, outside agencies, citizens, consultants, and developers; provide staff support to a variety of City boards, commissions, and committees as assigned. If assigned to traffic/transportation systems, participate in or initiate and complete traffic studies; evaluate signal sight distance, signage and striping; review and update traffic signals Improvement Standards; take corrective measures as warranted; design and bid minor signal improvement projects; generate and manage annual signal service agreements. Build and maintain positive working relationships with co-workers, other City employees, and the public using principles of good customer service. Perform related duties as assigned. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS In addition to the qualifications for the Junior Engineer: Knowledge of: Pertinent local, State, federal rules, regulations and laws related to area of engineering assignment. Methods, materials, and techniques used in the area of engineering assignment. Ability to: Check engineering plans and specifications; prepare and check engineering reports and studies. Interpret and explain City policies, procedures, regulations and engineering policies and procedures. Obtain information through interview, to handle multiple assignments, to work with interruption, and to deal firmly and courteously with citizens, developers, consultants, and contractors. EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING Experience: One year of responsible professional engineering work similar to that of a Junior Engineer with the City of Roseville. Training: A Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university, preferably with major course work in civil, environmental engineering or a closely related field; License or Certificate: Possession of a valid California driver’s license by date of appointment. SUPPLEMENTAL QUESTIONNAIRE Your responses to questions 2-3, the applicant’s education, training and experience, will be scored using a pre-determined formula. Your responses to these questions must be consistent with your employment application information. This experience must also be described in the “Work Experience" section of this application. Responses to the supplemental questionnaire that are inconsistent from your “Work Experience” section in the application will not be scored. I understand and agree with the above instructions. Yes No Was any of the work experience listed on your application an unpaid internship, or volunteer work? If so, please list below which ones. How many years do you have performing professional engineering duties in the investigation, planning, design, construction, maintenance or operations of public works facilities, systems, projects and/or private development projects? Less than 1 year 1-2 Years 2-3 Years 3-4 Years 4-5 Years 5+ Years Discuss how you prioritize your work and deal with competing priorities? Describe a Water or Wastewater (or other utility) design or construction project you have worked on and your role on the project. How would you handle a problematic team member who is non-cooperative? Explain your experience working with other public agencies such as Caltrans, Department of Fish and Wildlife Services, and Army Corps of Engineers, etc. as it relates to capital improvement projects. Do you have any experience in the following fields? Check the boxes to all that apply: a. Water b. Wastewater/Sewer c. Storm Drain/Storm Water Quality d. Roadway Design e. Signal Design f. Survey Mapping SELECTION PROCESS All candidates meeting the minimum qualifications will have their application scored in a Formula Rate Examination. The applicant’s experience and education will be evaluated using a pre-determined formula. Scores from this evaluation will determine applicant ranking and placement on the Employment List. Supplemental questions will be utilized by the department hiring authority to make interview and selection determinations. Final appointment is contingent upon a check of past employment references, passing a City-paid fingerprint check and depending on position applied for a pre-employment medical exam and a drug and alcohol screening test. THE CITY OF ROSEVILLE IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. IF YOU REQUIRE AN ACCOMMODATION DUE TO A DISABILITY, PLEASE CONTACT THE HUMAN RESOURCES DEPARTMENT AT LEAST 5 WORKING DAYS BEFORE A SCHEDULED INTERVIEW/EXAMINATION PROCESS. MEDICAL DISABILITY VERIFICATION MAY BE REQUIRED PRIOR TO ACCOMMODATIO For more information regarding the City's benefits, visit our website at here. This position is in Local 39.

Title: Mechanical Engineer
Text: Heliospace is looking for a Mechanical Engineer to contribute to the design, fabrication, assembly and test of aerospace hardware for missions in planetary science, astrophysics, and other applications. The majority of the work would involve deployable mechanisms in the form of booms, antennas, and related components and subsystems. Responsibilities Design, fabrication, assembly and test of aerospace hardware for NASA and other space programs Requirements Bachelor’s/equivalent or higher degree in mechanical or aerospace engineering Computer-aided design (CAD) experience required, SolidWorks preferred Capability to fulfill multiple roles is a plus. Other desirable skills include electrical or thermal engineering, quality-assurance, fabrication or other skills in aerospace related disciplines. Both entry-level and experienced candidates will be considered. Eligibility To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $84,100.00 - $91,100.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Disability insurance Flexible schedule Flexible spending account Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Parental leave Relocation assistance Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday COVID-19 considerations:We are following all state and local guidelines to keep our employees safe. Education: Bachelor's (Required) Company's website: https://helio.space/ Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/heliospace.global Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

The majority of the work would involve deployable mechanisms in the form of booms, antennas, and related components and subsystems. Requirements 5+ years of mechanical, electrical, thermal engineering, or other related disciplines in the aerospace industry.
